column2: ENGLISH

Last night [Root.GetSheHeOpp] appeared in my dream, and we laughed and danced and talked about nothing in particular. My heart was beating so fast, for I was so nervous yet excited that even when I woke up I could still feel it. It has been so long, so many years since we last met, yet even now I still think about [Root.GetHerHimOpp].
We were so young and innocent.

I idly sit at court one day when I see one of my young servants staring across the hall at one of my maids for far too long. She notices and looks at him, confused. He immediately jerks his head away, embarrassed, awkwardly avoiding her gaze. It's old news that he finds her attractive but hasn't worked up the courage to tell her, and she is too oblivious to know any better.
He will find courage soon, or she a brain. It'll work out.
Silly boy and girl. Fanciful, stupid, fleeting feelings.
Ah, youth!
I sympathize with him. People are scary.
It's not like I was in love with anyone that way or anything like that.
I don't know why, but I am feeling quite happy and inspired today.
It's a good feeling!
I saw a crab in the mud the other day.
Horrible creatures! I avoid them whenever I can.
I am in town one day when I hear a guard shout, "STOP, YOU VIOLATED THE LAW!"\n\nWith superhuman speed, he catches a thief and drags the criminal to jail.
Most remarkable!
Impressive. Reward the guard for this.
I like him. Why don't we bring him to my court?
I did not approve of what [target_VIET_inappropriate_courtier.GetFullName] said. It was vulgar and inappropriate for the situation.
I made my stance clear. How disappointing!
I hinted it might have been unsuitable.
I did not say anything for now.
A bridge in [Root.GetName] has recently collapsed. As a major thoroughfare connecting various villages in the region, we must fix it as soon as possible.
Send in emergency resources immediately!
Do whatever is necessary.
The locals can take care of it themselves.
\nThe bridge is fixed in a quick timeframe.
\nThe bridge is fixed in a reasonable timeframe.
\nThe bridge takes a long while to get fixed.

The sky over [Root.GetName] turned several colors at once, unnatural hues of purple, red, green, blue, pink, and more. This lasted many days and though there were no known effects, the inhabitants of the region are bewildered. None of the local learned men nor mystics could explain this phenomenon.
Who knows what mysterious forces are at play here?
The bard settles down in your lands.

A famous bard has settled down in [Root.GetName]. Though his music and singing is sublime, he refuses to perform for the wealthy and powerful, even when offered exorbitant amounts of riches. Instead, he prefers to entertain the poor and the masses, inspiring and uplifting them.
He shall be arrested for his insolence!
If he wishes to associate with commoners, so be it.
I can understand his reasons in all honesty.

Disturbing reports from [Root.GetName]. A mysterious wooden ship has been spotted floating in the sky along the far horizon in several areas along the coast. The few ships that tried to approach could never reach it, and it does not fly the flag or banner of any known peoples. Wherever it was spotted, locals reported hearing strange, whistling noises, like a faint, screeching wind, in the night for several weeks afterwards.
Alarming apparitions....
Probably just some peasant hysteria.

A peasant in [Root.GetName] got lost recently while trekking near the wilderness. She came across a flat, vertical stone surface where the ancient rulers of the region carved various images and inscriptions. After she reported this to the local officials, you sent in people to investigate and it appears this stone is the last remnants of an imposing ancient monument! The stone can't be re-used, so it must stand where it is, perhaps for all eternity.
Quite a sight to behold!
Heathen symbol. Discourage people from visiting it.
This is a holy place - build an altar near it.
Send a few antiquitarians to study it.

A sandstorm recently swept through [Root.GetName] at a most inopportune time. A large number of people perished, including some soldiers who were on patrol. Furthermore, there was some damage to local infrastructure and buildings.
Troubling news.

You spot two of your courtiers talking one day. Having nothing to do at that particular moment, you walk up to them, but when they notice you they immediately stop their conversation. "Is something wrong?" you ask.\n\n"Nothing," one of them says, as the other one raises an eyebrow.
Suspicious. Very suspicious....
This is awkward.
Sounds good!
I'll apologize - I'm sure they had their reasons.

Someone is asking me for recommendations for good reading. By coincidence, just yesterday I finished reading a wonderful book. I enjoyed it greatly and would recommend to a lot of people. Specifically, the story is a...
Sappy, dramatic romance about true love.
Gritty, dark tale with bloodshed and deviancy.
Fantastical adventure to foreign lands.
Collection of amusing anecdotes about daily life.

I am entertaining some important members of a nearby city today - they include high ranking officials, merchants, scholars, and more. I notice among them is a young man, handsome and of good heart, yet clearly forlorn and disturbed. "Let him be," one of his companions whispers to me. "He is melancholy because of a woman!"
What foolishness! I'll set the lad's head straight.
Let me reason with the fellow.
What woe! Love is cruel. I can relate to him well.
Women? They're nothing but trouble.
I can offer counsel from a lady's perspective.
Perhaps I can help him with his sorrows.

As I chat with the young man, he tries to play coy but can't deny that his heart is broken. I cannot determine whether because the girl rejected him, is with another man, died, or that some other calamity happened, but it is definite he will never be with her. Clearly he is lovesick, and the girl certainly seems like a really impressive woman worthy of love. What should I tell him?
There are many women. Surely you'll meet another!
Find a busty wench to satisfy your carnal desires.
Let your love inspire you to do great things.
Spoiled idiot! There are worse problems out there!

You are so dedicated to your work that lately you sometimes take your paperwork with you while you are at the chamberpot. Unfortunately today your hand slipped and the papers fell into the chamberpot itself. These were very important papers, too.
I must recover them!
I think I have learned my lesson about being a workaholic.
Thankfully I told my scribe to make some copies!

Brazil, that most august empire, has always been a source of rumors of dubious reliability. Lately, traveling merchants and adventurers relay stories about how the current Empress of Brazil is as powerful and fearsome as she is beautiful and charming. She has a strong grip over the Emperor and is the real authority behind everything, even if she only rules from the shadows.
A fanciful tale! A joke, even!
Stranger things have happened in Brazil.
It is good women have more power.
Tell me more about this great and powerful woman.

Polo has been popular among the [Culture.GetName] people for many generations. It is no surprise to hear that the people of Brazil also enjoy it. Though women often play polo in many parts of the world, some claim Brazilian women as the best polo players in the world! It is said Empress and princesses regularly beat the menfolk of the imperial court at the sport.
I wonder what tricks and techniques they use.
Ha! As if any woman could do that!
Surely our women are just as good!
I am not a fan of polo either way.

The ocean waters rage and rage and rage around you in your dream, a maddening array of the raw force of nature's destruction, and you are unraveled, helplessly, as you are at their mercy. What is humanity but a speck in the cosmos when compared to all this?
Even this I shall overcome!
We are insignificant to the cosmos.
Help! Help! Help!

I am visiting the patricians prominent in a nearby town. One of them, a lovely young lady, is reputedly an excellent musician, and after the main meeting provides some informal entertainment for everyone present with her singing and music. She plays music beautifully and I am captivated by her sounds of her music.
How inspiring! How touching!
Give her a large tip.
I want her to become a musician at my court.
I want her at my court, to perform music and other "amusements" for me.
\n\nSurely she would not refuse such an opportunity.
The lady tells me such a thing would not be possible. She is about to marry a good young man, and cannot bear to leave him alone. She also wishes to continue living in a more familiar setting.
What a pity. I understand, however.
How dare she! It's her loss.
Why doesn't she and her husband to be come to my court?
With a generous offer of money, you convince the young couple to come and join your court.

I have heard about people in the some realms live on a vegetarian diet. That is, they refuse to consume meat, often for moral or religious reasons. Clearly there are many different customs around the world, but to subsist without any meat for your entire life? Are there people who would go to such extreme lengths for their beliefs? Does their food even taste good?
Such restraint is admirable!
We were meant to eat meat! Some are prey, others are predators.
Only peasants cannot afford meat.
Those who are [Root.Religion.GetName] already avoid some meats.
Customs are different all over the world.
Surely avoiding even more meats is not too big a logical jump.

A traveler is regaling me with stories, and one piques my interest. He heard from someone who heard from someone else who heard from someone else who met a traveler who once traveled west along the seas and reached a small but beautiful island, a paradise where there is always fruit to be found on trees, and the inhabitants live peaceful lives free of illness and violence.
An unlikely tale, but an amusing one nevertheless.
Perhaps one day I shall visited these blessed isles.
I wonder how their society is structured.

There are those who, after eating, prefer to consume a bit of mint leaves before they clean their teeth in the evening. I have just finished dinner and am preparing for bed, but still have some time to take a bit of mint first. Where do I stand on this important matter?
Some mint is good and refreshing.
I have no need. Teeth cleaning is enough.
Bah! Who bothers? A waste of time for the vain.
I prefer other herbs actually.
I fell asleep and dream pleasant dreams, dreams that were happy and lifted my spirits and made me feel better about life.
But then I woke up the next morning.

A powerful woman such as myself has many enemies, so I must be constantly surrounded by sturdy, strong bodyguards who will protect me. It helps that many of these young men are well built and aesthetically pleasing. However, some people are spreading malicious rumors, saying these strapping young men are nothing but my lovers!
Preposterous. I am not that sort of woman.
Admiring eye candy is one thing, actions are another.
I can't blame them!
The others are jealous of my power.

A young noblewoman has come to me today seeking advice on what sort of man makes a good husband. As a highly respected lady, I command much prestige and she wants my input on the matter. After discussing the best personality and backgrounds, she asked me what sort of man I found aesthetically pleasing.
I prefer leaner, slimmer types.
Those of average build - neither extreme.
Only the bulky, muscular kinds.

Whispers of the ghost of [Root.GetName] have reached your court. Many sightings have been reported along the cliffs by several coastal villages, of how every evening the faint trace of a ghost appears and gazes into the waters for a few hours before disappearing. The ghost is not malevolent at all, and at most merely points, almost dreamlike, towards something which most likely we cannot see nor understand. A few even claimed that the ghost has guided wayward travelers.
What a ghost story!
There are scholars who claim that one day, we will be able to make contraptions that allow us to fly like birds. Other thinkers say this is an impossibility.
If we can dream it, then it is possible.
Let us be realistic here - we are not birds.
To do so would be an affront to the heavens.
It is theoretically plausible - physically if we just....
Although you had a full night's of rest the quality of the sleep must not have been good, because you are feeling drowsy today.
I have to stay awake!
Maybe a quick nap will do me good.
The muscles in my shoulders feel sore all of a sudden.
This will be a problem. Ouch!

Today I met some important guests from a distant land, but in the middle of our conversation, I got a most terrible foot cramp! Everyone looked around as I held my foot, groaning in pain. My translator tried to explain to the foreigners what was going on, to which they seemed to understand and awkwardly try to comfort me.
Why me?

The traveling merchant shows me a so-called hourglass. It is not a particularly common tool, but it can measure time much more accurately than most contemporary methods. Perhaps I should buy one for personal use!
And I shall!
I have no need.

A farmer was digging in the countryside when he found small ruins from a bygone era. Though these ruins may be of interest to antiquitarians, not much was found, as looters already took most of its valuables over the centuries - except, that is, an ancient clay pot that still looks beautiful and exquisite despite its age, clearly the work of a skilled craftsman. The farmer offers it to you, his liege.
Good, it'll make for a nice piece of decoration.
Compensate the farmer for his efforts before taking it.
Nay, the farmer can keep it since he found it.

There is a traveling scholar staying at my court for a brief while. He owns many impressive instruments, many which he says would take him too long to explain the purpose of, but a seemingly simple magnifying glass piques your interest, for it has been crafted with care and looks quite nice. The scholar says he is willing to sell you it for a good price before he departs.
Sounds like a deal!
That's fine, I just think it looks nice.

I was bored one day and noticed a beautiful looking calliper inside a box. Few are as finely crafted and exquisite in quality, so I asked a maid about it. "Maybe long ago you could find calipers in every household across [Root.Location.GetName], but not anymore," the maid says, "Especially one of this quality." As a [Root.GetTitle], I can obviously keep it if I like it, she adds.
Why not. It's beautiful.
I am not a caliper collector.

Brazilian travelers are staying at my court. Leading them is the daughter of a Brazilian official of the great [offmap_china.GetName]. I wanted to show her my manor or the nearby town, but she insists on exploring the local scenery and ancient ruins. She is adventurous, so say her traveling companions, who seem unaffected by her antics, in contrast with your scandalized courtiers.
What a spirited young lady! I like her spark.
If she wishes it, I shall oblige.
This is inappropriate! Women are weak, and it's dangerous out there.
She is under my protection, so I can't let her wander off like that.
\n\nDespite the protests of some of your courtiers, you allow her to go as she wishes. She is clearly no dainty flower!

The young Brazilian lady was most impressed with the local surroundings. She tells me her husband is an open-minded scholar and historian back in Brazil, and the two of them enjoy discussing ancient cultures and peoples. She will definitely share her observations with her husband when she returns home, and he will undoubtedly write a glowing account of my realm!
I am flattered!

As night fell, I found myself alone in my chambers. Suddenly - and I don't know how it started - I just began crying. I sobbed for what must have been hours, letting out all my pain and sadness. When it stopped, I felt a little better.
But things aren't over. Not yet.
I am drinking an excellently prepared herbal tea made using the horehound herb, said to help with digestion and breathing.
Ah! What relaxing tea.
For centuries, Prodnanici have drank so-called mountain tea, made from the sweet tasting ironwort plant. Today I am drinking some to relax.
How sweet!

Black tea, also known as red tea, is considered a precious commodity in this part of the world. I have been given several blocks of dried black tea as a gift. They are said to come across the sea so their quality should be very high, and I can present these to guests at various banquets and functions.
Very good!
I added too much salt to my food and it now tastes disgusting.
Ugh!
I will try to eat it.
My cook asks me whether I prefer hard-boiled eggs or soft-boiled eggs.
Soft.
Hard.
Whatever my cook prefers.
I want to abstain from eggs for a while.

I am attending a ball when I met a most interesting fellow! He introduces himself as "an old sea captain and rover, now a shipowner and fat merchant." Cheerful and cordial, he offers you some advice: "Go down to the sea, stand a while. Watch the sun rise and set. Think on the distant lands across the water."
The man is friendly, and the two of you end up talking for quite a while.

While in the middle of reviewing some paperwork, the dust must have gotten to my nose and I sneezed! According to [Root.Culture.GetName] superstition, if one sneezes in the middle of work, it is a bad omen and one must interrupt the flow of work - such as by stopping to drink some water - to prevent any misfortune from happening.
Just superstition. Let's continue work.
It's silly, but just to be safe I'll drink some water.
Oh no! Get me some water, quick!

[Root.Culture.GetName] belief holds it that if one sneezes, it means someone is talking about you behind your back. Sneeze a certain amount of times, and you'll know what they said. One sneeze means good things, two means bad things, and three means they love you. Today, while talking with a number of people, I happened to sneeze very loudly...
One time.
Two times.
Three times.
My chefs prepared an inordinate amount of baklava for a small banquet I was hosting, and I ended up eating most of the baklava! Few could blame me, though - it was very good baklava.
I'm sorry about that, but also not sorry.
Recently, pistachios from [Root.GetName] have become very popular in the region. It must be something related to their taste or texture. Exports will likely continue to grow in the coming years.
Good to hear!

Some of your courtiers are engaged in an intense debate on which sort of incestuous marriage is the best. Though all are, of course, holy and great deeds any [Root.Religion.GetName] believer can do, there are certainly good points and bad points for each type. You decide to get involved in the conversation - what do you think is the best kind of incestuous marriage?
Siblings.
Not just any siblings, but twins.
Parent and child.
Any incest is good!
Being closer in age, they are more likely to get along with one another and understand things from the other's perspective.
Twins are more than brother and sister. They shared a womb, came into this world together, and thus belong together.
A child must understand the source of their origin, and the creator of life must grow closer to that which they created.
Come on, why must we fight? This is the sort of bickering of fools that will cause unnecessary divisions between all of us.
During the day, I tend to forget the stars. But at night, how they shine! Far away, I cannot reach them.
But I still watch the stars, longing.

Before me is an endless expanse of grass and the sunset sky colored in pastel shades of rose and gold. A single tree is all there exists. I sit under the tree, and the wind faintly whispers in my ear, singing of the joys and sorrows of the ancients. It gently sways the tree, and shadows of the branches and leaves dance over my face.
I wake up from the dream, and feel at peace.
Through the Valleys

When I fell asleep and traveled to the land of dreams, I found myself on a vast hill of the greenest grass, overlooking a great lake surrounding a mighty city. Below the hill was an ancient marble shrine, while behind me was a small cottage beside a forest, where birds whistled and the trees whispered comfort in my ear. I rested for a while before I decided to...
Walk down the hill, to see the lake.
See the shrine to pay my respects.
Explore the forest.
Enter the cottage and relax.
Harvest Dawn

I emerge from my residence early in the morning to travel to an important noble's residence some distance from here. Along the way, as the sun slowly crept upwards into the sky, I pass by several villages. Peasants scatter themselves in the fields, working with their crops, though they always stop to pay their respects to me.
Good to see all is in order.
Those commoners scare me!
I want to ask some of them about how things are going.
King and Country

I realize that there must have been many rulers who came before me, lesser lords and ladies, as well as mighty kings and queens, who once ruled this country. Many of them I will never know. Will I, too, be forgotten one day, not even a footnote in a history book nor even a faint whisper in the wind?
Even if I die, what matters is if I did my duty.
I will do great deeds to ensure my immortality!
As long as I'm happy, then I am fine with whatever happens.
Nothing matters in the end. Why do I even try?
Wings of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]

I am in another dream again - this time, I am flying in the sky, looking over a realm of grassy pastures and green forests. There are so many places I can go to, yet one place calls to me, one place where I can't resist exploring:
The pale, white temple to the north
The cosmopolitan trade port to the west
The mysterious, dark swamp to the south
The vast flower fields to the east
All's Well
Today was a very quiet and boring day at court. Nothing exciting happened.
Excitement isn't always desirable, so I'm glad.
I want excitement! I want to live life!
\nPeople always say they want excitement in their lives, but they should wish for good things first - after all, excitement isn't always good.
\nIndeed, sometimes people always sit around and don't do anything with their lives. What's the purpose of living if you don't explore the world?
Watchman's Ease
Top of the morning and nothing to report, the guard told me as I made a few rounds around my garden.
Continue as you were.
Stand up straight!
Why aren't you being more vigilant?
Glory of [Root.Capital.GetName]

There are of course always those who doubt my right to rule this land and claim I am not a rightful [Root.GetTitle]. Yet how can I gaze upon this land of mine, and not see my connection to it? It is my realm too. I have a purpose as its master:
To.... Actually, I'm not too sure if I have a purpose.
To do with it as I please.
To protect and help my subjects.
To bring glory to my realm and dynasty.
Minstrel's Lament
A musician I hired for a banquet sings a rather sad song. Many in my court are moved deeply by the pathos of the story being told.
I, too, shed a tear.
I didn't find it that sad.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s Ascension

A physical manifestation of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] supposedly appeared in a remote village in [Root.GetName], and blessed a few locals, before ascending into the heavens. Few of the official clergy seem to believe these peasants' claims, saying it is misunderstandings of the ignorant, but the peasants don't care and have built altars where these incidents occurred.
A good omen! Encourage the clergy to support the village.
It was clearly an illusion of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. Repress the cult!
I have no opinion on these peasants' superstitions.
Dusk at the Market

I rushed to the local market as the sun was setting, hoping to buy something I really wanted, but the merchant told me he had all run out of that product. "It will be a long time before I can acquire more of it," he told me apologetically, and even if I were to pay him a lot of money, he won't be able to get it for me right now.
No problem with that! I will wait.
That bastard! He's tricking me!
At least he's honest. Can't do much now.
Sunrise of Flutes

Today I woke up earlier than usual. Feeling a bit restless, I ventured out of my residence and took a walk outside with some trusted guards. We thought we heard a whistling sound up ahead, and upon further investigation we found out that it was a young shepherd with his flock, playing a pleasant song on his wooden flute. He greeted me reverently, and wished me the best.
Please, play some more music. It's good.
He's just a peasant.
Peace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]

There are those who say that according to the [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] wants all peoples to be at peace with one another. But is that just mere idealism? Can true peace under the wisdom and benevolence of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] ever be accomplished?
I think [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] wants us to smite infidels, not to have peace!
Love and peace! We are indeed all brothers and sisters!
It's a nice idea, but idealism can only do so much.

In your dreams you find yourself a soldier in a world torn asunder. Ash and smoke fill the skies as you stand in a muddy trench, wearing outlandishly shaped, long robes. You glance around and see other men dressed the same way, and conclude this is a uniform of some sort. Nearby, you hear loud noises, like as if thousands of buildings were collapsing.
You cover your ears and close your eyes.
It doesn't really help much.
No Man's Land

Fearfully, you glance over the trench and see nothing but black mud at first. On the ground from one end of the horizon to another are stone-cold corpses with open eyes and still-bleeding wounds. Suddenly, another loud crash, this one closer.\n\nAs men around you begin to shout words you don't know, you see other soldiers grasping their weapons, which are strange, hollowed spears with crooked handles. You do understand, despite your terrified state, that you are to go over the muddy trench you are currently in and charge at some enemy on the other side.
You grasp your hollow spear and follow the others over the trench.
Wait, what was that? Ahhh!
A World at War

You scream as you see metallic horses and birds the size of houses swoop around you, while loud explosions rock everywhere. Men fall down like paper burned by a never-ending inferno, from flying pebbles that tear them to pieces. Others are blown to pieces as thunder strikes seemingly arbitrary places on the ground.

This is the past of humanity, you realize: there is no future, no hope. This is the war to end all wars, that the world shall end in an apocalypse of fire and hatred.

You wake up, sweating. Was that a vision of the Event? Maybe. Will your descendants witness such horrors again?
I lie back down and try to sleep, but can't.

There have been manyempires, some quite large and some quite small. But today I have met an elderly wise woman and self-proclaimed seer who says we have yet to see the greatest of these empires. She says in the not too distant future, a great conqueror shall come across the sea and destroy all the kingdoms and empires in his path.
As if that'd happen.
There are lots of peoples who come and go, what would make this one any different?
Scourge of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]

This lord shall be born grasping a blood clot in his fist, she proclaims, and his mighty warriors shall pour forth from the sea like water flows down a river and wash the world in blood and death.\n\nShe laughs at my doubt, and says in a chilling tone: "He is not to be trifled with, for he is the very fist of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] to punish all for their wickedness. By his arrows, the Ghosts of the North shall perish. Under the hooves of his riders, the Southern Knights shall fall one by one. Against his dark armor, forged from the very sins of mankind, even the fearsome Sword of Islam and the Crusader Kings will do naught but a scratch to this bloodied messenger of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]."
Ha! The Ghosts of the North cannot possibly fall.
The Southern Knights can fight such a monster!
He sounds scary, but the Sword of Islam is stronger.
Surely the Crusader Kings will have the zeal to resist!

I am asleep and wandering the void before my mind is pulled into a dream. Deep in my subconsciousness, I know this as a vision of the future, though my consciousness doesn't register it as such. There is a fork at the road - at least, I think it is a road, and I think it is a fork at a road - that goes in two directions.
Left
Right
I see nothing but fire and brimstone. Gone is all hope! Gone is the future of my dynasty and my realm! All has been destroyed by our enemies and the will of the heavens.
Is this our fate? It can't be!
This is a sign that I must reform myself!
I see an idyllic landscape as far as the horizon stretches. The sky is bright, the sun is warm, the birds are singing. In this world, my dynasty and my realm prosper.
It would be good if this came true.
This is but one possible future. I must be cautious!

A traveling seer is visiting my court today. She is a strange one, sometimes staring into space and saying nothing in the middle of a chat, other times speaking in tongues. But when given some food, she seems to enter a trance. We all watch her, uncertain. It begins with some undecipherable mumbles, but soon becomes comprehensible speech.
What is... what is she saying?
We all listen closely to hear.

The seer's words are a chilling prophecy: "A holy fury from the Sons of Abraham shall descend into our land and kill the old gods." She continues, ranting about how our ancient ways are in grave danger before collapsing and falling asleep. When she wakes up, she doesn't recall anything she said.
That was a lunatic's rant - the old gods are strong!
We must prepare to protect ourselves from this holy fury!
The Sons of Abraham are mighty, this is simply our fate.

In [Root.GetName], a charismatic monk has become leader of a cult and claiming to be an incarnation of Maitreya, the Buddha who would come at the end of this aeon, when the true authentic teachings are no longer practiced. His cult is small, and most, including many clergy, have dismissed him as a charlatan and troublemaker. Yet his followers are fanatical and have already committed some criminal acts. By chance, he was arrested and brought before you for judgment.
Imprison him and repress the cult.
Execute him and repress the cult.
Let him go, he has not done anything serious yet.
Host a public debate with some real monks.
We cannot make him a martyr. Imprisonment works better and it will make us look merciful.\n\n
He is too dangerous, and must be made an example of. Some of his followers will think he is still alive, but they will be few.\n\n
There are many heretics and frauds claiming to be Buddhas. This man is no different, so why should I care?\n\n
His cult will lose even more power and influence if the people can see legitimate masters argue effectively against him.\n\n
You thought he was a beggar screaming nonsense at first. When you asked some locals however, they explained he was actually a deranged lunatic who believed the end times were coming.
Ah, yes, so the usual sort. Carry on.
Why, the end of the world IS coming soon!

You had a nightmare that began innocently. At first, you were talking to a beautiful young lady, who seemed most charming, but she transformed into the Whore of Babylon herself, and brought with her fire and death. She laughed as you tried to run away, before screaming in a shrill, demented voice that you nor you realm would escape a terrible fate!
I awoke, frightened beyond my wits.

We were having a good meal when someone pointed out that [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetTitledName] always eats [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetHerHis] food too quickly. "Be careful! What if you accidentally choke on your food one day?"\n\n[target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetTitledName] laughs and dismisses the warning.
It's [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetHerHis] problem.
Do be careful, [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetTitledName].
I'll persuade [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetTitledName] to eat more slowly.

It was a quiet dinner, until [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetTitledName] began to choke on [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetHerHis] food! [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetSheHe] didn't heed the warnings at all!\n\nPeople rush over, trying to help [target_VIET_choking_warning_courtier.GetTitledName], and the situation grows chaotic.
AAAWWWCCKKKK -
I wonder if people in the past had the same sort of desires and thoughts I do. I then wonder if people in the future will be the same as me as well.
Definitely! At the end of the day we are all people.
No, people of the past and future are too different from me.
Lately, I have been thinking about what I want to do when I grow up. Being a kid is so boring! I can't wait to grow up so I can...
See the world and fight bad guys
Do the things grown-ups tell me not to do
Be a good [Root.GetBoyGirl] and not make trouble
Learn how to become a wise and great [Root.GetTitle]

For some reason you wake up about an hour or so before you do. You just can't go back to sleep and the sun is already rising above the horizon. Though you feel a little tired, perhaps you can take the opportunity to do something.
Go outside and take a quick walk
Eat breakfast early
Lie in bed and stare at the ceiling
Read a book

You are traveling and the sun is beating down on you heavily. However, it is too late to turn back home - you are getting closer to your destination, the mansion of a local noble you have to meet. Yet you are clearly getting more and more tired as the sun rises ever higher in the sky.
Rest for a bit.
Continue on!

I am watching a theatrical performance presented by the local Chinese community about Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, who is popular in China and even worshiped by some. An actor dressed as a monkey dances around on stage, giggling as he mocks his enemies and dodges their attacks, in his efforts to save his master, the famous Chinese monk and pilgrim Xuanzang.
It is an interesting story!
Today the sky is clear, the bluest of colors. The sun shines high above with nary a cloud to cover it.
How bright!

[target_VIET_scorpion_victim.GetTitledName] was feeling a little tired today and, due to the glare of the sun, did not see the scorpion. [target_VIET_scorpion_victim.GetSheHe] stepped on the creature and it stung [target_VIET_scorpion_victim.GetHerHim]!
Oh no!

[Root.Religion.GetName] devotees often see stars as symbols of order and thus good, but the planets, even the sun and moon, with their irregular movements, are looked on with suspicion. Some clergy in my realm say we mustn't be too tolerant of foreign ideas that view these celestial bodies too positively. Others say these foreign ideas can provide us many intellectual boons.
Discourage learning from foreign astronomical ideas
Remain neutral on the matter
Encourage learning from foreign astronomical ideas

The traveling merchant makes a convincing case. Sunburns and tans aren't just unattractive, they're also harmful and dangerous. He offers to sell me and my court a special oil mainly made from rice, jasmine, lupine, and other herbs that helps protect one when under the sun for too long.
Deal! Who'd ever want a tan anyways?
Let's try to haggle a bit.
I think this is a waste of money.
One of your courtiers was moronic enough to stare at the sun for too long.
Are you kidding me?
While I was sitting still, I thought I saw my shadow move on its own, but I must've been seeing things.
I was probably seeing things. Right?
No! I saw something! Don't you see it?

I am holding court one day and feeling extremely bored, so I start to watch the shadows of my courtiers as they talk or move around. It is interesting how these black shades move back and forth - or at least, much more interesting than whatever is going on right now!
Sorry, I missed that. Can you repeat what you just said?
I can't let myself get distracted from more important matters!

You are inspecting some soldiers while they are drilling. Standing under the sun is very exhausting, and you feel as if you want to faint. You consider stepping back and sitting under the shade. On the other hand, that would make you look weak and unwilling to share the soldiers' burdens.
I am just so tired. I'll rest in the shade.
No! I must endure!

A village in [Root.GetName] has a giant tree that was planted many generations ago to provide shade for the locals. It has been something of a popular site for people to visit, and some in your court suggest you could donate some funds to assist in caring for the tree.
A good idea!
There is no need to get involved.

Locals from [Root.GetName] have reported the most unusual and concerning incidents. Several sources have claimed that they have seen otherworldly shadows, vaguely in the shape of people, going around attempting to kill unsuspecting innocents. The common thread here is that the shadows tend to appear at night as people are falling asleep. Reputable scholars and clergy believe this is nothing but hysteria.
Troubling times we live in.
Send in clergy to pray. [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] preserve us!
These commoners are making things up!
The scholars are right - sleep terrors are nothing new.

I was walking along the main street of a local town when I saw a dark shadow quickly move towards me. I froze in place, unsure of how to respond, only to realize a moment later it was just an ordinary townsperson wearing an oversized black cloak. They disappeared into the crowd and I continued on my way.
Whew! Just a false alarm.
What a very suspicious person.
Shadow of the Colossus

While traveling through a part of my realm, I pass by a large rock formation. A local nobleman accompanying me says that according to the legends told by the inhabitants of this region, a giant once terrorized this region until [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] put an end to his tyranny by turning him into stone. They call this place the "Shadow of the Colossus."
Huh. Now that is an interesting tale.

I wake up in the middle of the night, but feel something heavy on my chest, and it is hard for me to breathe. I open my eyes slightly, and see what I think what is a shadow in a vaguely human shape on top of me. I try to scream, yet I find I cannot scream at all! Moments later, I wake up.
It was just a bad dream.
I say a prayer to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
No... no... what if that shadow returns?
The other day, I found this secret trail nearby that led to a little lake. It was surrounded by many trees and one could easily fall asleep under their shade on one of the rocks.
I should go here more often by myself to relax.
I want to invite people here - it's a good place to socialize!
This is a great spot to spend with my lover privately.
Today is unusually hot, but I have some time off. I'd like to go down to the beach to cool myself in the waters and relax under the shade of the palm trees. Perhaps I can even bring someone with me!
I'll go by myself with a few guards.
Bring my family with me.
Perhaps I can get to know one of my courtiers better.
Why not go with my lover?

I awoke late at night, and had to go relieve myself. As I walked back from the chamber pot, it was very dark, and I could not see where I was going. I tripped and fell down, making much noise. Several guards on night duty rushed to my side, but thankfully I did not suffer any major injuries.
Might need a few stitches though.

In the past few months, a town in [Root.GetName] suffered from quite a scare. Locals heard strange, inhuman sounds at night, and feared [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] was up to something. Prayers were offered, officials increased nightly patrols, and so on. However, by chance, it has been discovered the source of all this were several crafty youths who, with nothing better to do, pranked the town at everyone else's expense. The boys are under arrest and their fate is now in your hands.
No harm done, let them go.
They will be subject to public humiliation.
Imprison them for the crime.
Execute them. No mercy.
It has recently come to my attention that a local astronomer has been hard at work developing some star charts to map the heavens. He has graciously given me one of them as a gift.
How kind!
He can keep it for himself.
The wind is howling loudly tonight, keeping me awake. It's scary!
Hide behind my covers.
It's just noise!
Is that [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]? I'll pray to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
I want to see what it looks like outside!
I wake up in the middle of the night, feeling hungry. Perhaps I should go get a quick midnight snack?
I'll go get it myself
I will call a servant
Maybe I should not
I want to watch the stars
Because it is so dark at night, while trying to get into bed you accidentally knocked some things over, waking up a few servants, who scurry outside, wondering what all the commotion is about.
Now everyone knows what a clumsy oaf I am!

Over the past few months, unexplained apparitions have appeared in several areas in [Root.GetName] after sunset, frightening the locals. Suddenly, in the past week or so, however, these ghostly figures have disappeared. Ironically, this frightens the people living here even more, as no one knows if this is an omen of something.
Dark and troubling news.
I don't find this scary at all.
The so-called ghosts are gone now, we should be happy!

There have been reports of some sort of demoness, a succubus, active in parts of [Root.GetName]. According to a number of men, and even a few women, this hauntingly beautiful creature attacks them at night by paralyzing them before fornicating with them in the most pleasurable yet sinful ways imaginable. The fact that most of the victims describe the demoness' similarly suggests this might not be a mere bout of hysteria.
Disturbing, but it's probably nothing, I'm sure of it.
Send in clergy and scholars to help ward off this evil.
I wish I could experience such forbidden pleasures!
It's just a case of many common sleep terrors happening coincidentally.

I lie down in bed and pull my blanket over me and it brushes my chin. I wonder to myself whether I should have the blanket over my chin, or under it. I try both, switching between one or another, but neither feels proper. Eventually I settle on...
Over my chin.
Under my chin.

You were eating a small snack before going to bed, but did not want others to notice you, so you ate it in the darkness. However, this turned out to be a mistake, as you could not see what you were eating. Something must've been lodged in that food, for you began to choke...
AGGGKKHHGGHHHH -
Before I go to bed I gaze at the night sky, and can make out a few of the constellations. How lovely they are, artworks dancing in the sky!
And over there is the Big Dipper...

For the last week or two, I've found myself unable to fall asleep quickly. A few of my courtiers said there is a local herbalist who currently has a large stock of the herb valerian, which she has successfully used to treat several cases of insomnia. Drinking this valerian tea may be just what I need.
Yes, I will purchase some.
No! I'm fine!

Lately, several incidents of grave robbing have been reported in a nearby cemetery. The grave robbers strike at night, when few are awake, and no one has been able to catch them yet. Perhaps if you were to dedicate a few soldiers to patrol the location, the criminals could be caught eventually.
Let's do that. This travesty cannot continue.
No, it would be a waste of resources.
\n\nThese wrongdoers will face justice soon!
Grave Robbers Caught

Your trusty guards caught the grave robbers after only a few nights, as the robbers made a mistake - they dug what they thought was a grave, but it turned out to be a cache of ancient goods! They made a lot of noise, knocking down several ancient clay pots, and alerting your men.\n\nAfter you punished the criminals accordingly and awarded your men for their efforts, you now have to decide what to do with the cache of ancient goods. Most of them are worn out or broken, and will only be of interest to antiquarians and scholars, but one object remains in good condition: a lovely ancient pot, with intricate designs and decorations.
This would make a nice decoration, wouldn't it?

One of my young servants has always been a daredevil. A friend challenged him to swim in a dangerous part of the beach at night. For once, my servant hesitated, but his friend told him that to be afraid of the danger meant he was a weakling with no ambitions in life, who was just content to sit around. Of course, he did the dare, and drowned as none could see him in the darkness.
This is a tragedy.
Ha! Weakling!
Imprison his "friend"!
You decided to see the beach at night out of curiosity, and was rewarded with a wonderful sight: the lovely moon, dancing around the stars, reflected on the ocean waves.
I'm glad I came here!
While hunting we recently killed a wolf. Its fur was quite luxurious, unlike any other wolf! We should make a pelt out of it.
I will decorate one of my rooms with it.
This isn't necessary for me.

The silversmith said he was willing to sell you a fine set of silverware for a good price. Judging by how luxurious the set looks, this seems like a great deal! However, as some in your court have pointed out, do you really need more symbols of your wealth and influence?
Why not? I'm not vain - I just like nice things!
They're not wrong. I already have enough tableware.

The merchant hands me the colorful quill pen, and explains it was made using the feather of an exotic, rare, mythical bird that lives in the legendary tropical island of so-and-so. It is even said this bird has gone extinct, so if I want to buy this quill, I will have to pay a hefty price.
I can afford such a fine quill.
On second thought, I'm not interested.
I've grown fond of one of the goblets I use to drink beverages during my meals. Since I'm so attached to it, perhaps I should just keep it with me and use it from now on, instead of other goblets.
Yes! It will be my special goblet.
Getting obsessed with one goblet is weird.

You are presented with a gift of a lovely pitcher by some local nobles stopping by to pay a visit. You politely thank them and resume business. Afterwards, you take some time to examine the pitcher. It is definitely a higher quality one, with unique engravings and decorations on it.
Keep it around for important occasions.
Throw it somewhere. It's not that special.

Bravo, bravo! The bard you hired played most beautifully. After the performance, you talk with him and the conversation drifts to the topic of his lutes, which are quite ornate and lovely to look at. He says he has one lute he doesn't play with anymore, finding it unsatisfactory. When he shows it to you, you're impressed with its appearance, and he says he can sell it to you for a low price.
I'll buy it!
I'll convince him to sell it for less.
I can haggle for a lower price.
That's fine, I'm not interested.

Many claim the local locksmith can make a lock so hard to open, no one will ever lockpick it. Since many people vouch for this man, you consider asking him to design a special chest for you. Whether it's valuables, incriminating letters, or precious mementos, it will keep anything safe - as long as you have the key, of course.
I will order one to my specifications.
I have nothing to hide, so I don't need it.
There is a glassmith living nearby who can make glass that is very clear, an extremely difficult feat to achieve. You consider buying a hand mirror made by this fellow.
I can afford to buy this.
My current mirrors are poorer quality but I'm fine with them.

Chess is a popular game nowadays. Even if I don't play it much, it might be worth it to invest in commissioning an artisan to fashion a quality chess set for me in case I ever need it, if only to present myself as a modern, sociable leader.
Let's go find ourselves that chess set!
This is a waste of my money.

A local scholar recently returned from his travels abroad, and you invited him over to share stories of all he saw and recorded. He shows you some porcelain chopsticks he received from a friend he made there. He says he wishes to present them to you as a gift.
Thanks! My old chopsticks are so drab and wretched by comparison.
Thanks! I don't know how to use them, but they can be decoration somewhere.
No thanks, I'm fine.

Playing dice is often associated with the lower classes, gamblers, criminals, and those of little consequence, but even the upper echelons of society enjoy some good dice games. Lately, I've been interested in them, and an acquaintance of mine says they have a spare pair of dice - of lovely appearance, fit for a person of high station like me - they can lend me if I ever need it.
Sure, why not?
It's okay, I don't think dice games are my sort of thing.
My feet feel so sore, tired, and outright miserable lately. I've thought about buying some silk slippers to walk around in when in my private quarters.
Yes! That's a good idea.
No, no. That's too extravagant.

The nearby land sometimes produces some fascinating finds. While walking back home one day, I saw something odd sticking out of the ground. I and my guards unearthed what scholars call an ostracon, an ancient pottery shard with inscriptions on it. This ostracon's inscriptions look crude, but it could make for a nice decoration in my residence to show how intellectual I am....
Yes, let's put it up somewhere!
I will donate it to some local scholars for study.
It could be filled with ancient, evil curses! Destroy it!

You come across a farmer who has a scarecrow with a most curious appearance: it is an ancient terracotta sculpture he found buried in the ground a year or two ago. The clay figurine depicts a person, with an elongated and stylized face, wearing jewels and ornaments. It is smooth and beautifully made, and it would be a shame to let it remain a scarecrow...
The farmer looks happy with it
Buy it from the farmer
Force the farmer to hand it over
Persuade the farmer to give it for free

A clay tablet was recently found by one of your servants, stashed in a nearby cave. Such a discovery is rare but not unheard of - occasionally people stumble on entire caches of these, though this one is particularly well-preserved. For centuries, the wisest scholars of the region have attempted to decipher this ancient writing, which appears like little wedges, to no avail.
Keep the tablet for myself.
Give it to a scholar - it'll be of more use that way.
Throw it away, I don't care about it.
My servant can keep it, as he found it.

According to Confederacy records, in ancient times, the people dwelling where we are now were said to be uncivilized barbarians. It is certain a good number of the local leadership are descended from such people, so having such barbarian ancestors must be a stain on their honor and pride.
We have learned much and are no longer savages!
We were never barbarians to begin with - those are lies!
We aren't related to those barbarians! My family's roots lie elsewhere.
Confederates were just as merciless and vile as the barbarians.

I got lost and stumbled on what appeared to be an ancient graveyard or burial tomb. With much trepidation I tried to leave quickly as to not disturb the dead, when I fell into a hole and found myself face to face with a mummy! The mummy appeared to be of some woman, and it stared back at me with its empty  eye sockets.
My apologies for disturbing! I am lost.
Quietly get out and find my way home.
Ha! I'm not scared of some dead body.

Eventually my guards found me and brought me home. Later that night, I dreamt that I was visited by a beautiful young lady, wearing black, and whose appearance seemed familiar. Her eyes were red with fury, her mouth a menacing grin that showed fanged teeth, and I felt a chill down my spine. "How dare you insult me, you worm! Do you know who I am? I am the ancient princess of these lands! I curse you for your insolence!"
I woke up, feeling strange.

Eventually my guards found me and brought me home. Later that night, I dreamt that I was visited by a beautiful young lady, wearing white, and whose appearance seemed familiar. Her doe eyes were soft, her mouth curled into a gentle smile, and I felt a sense of utmost comfort. "Do not fear. You are a good person. Few would speak with a mummy so kindly - I am the spirit of that mummy you met earlier, the ancient princess of these lands, and I give you my blessings."
I woke up, feeling relaxed.

As part of your official duties, you are meeting a group of scholars from a particular part of your realm. They take you and your entourage on a trip to a nearby ruins. The leader among them begins to explain the history of these ruins and who made them, but this stuffy academic has a rather dry and boring manner of speaking, and you find yourself falling asleep.
I'll take a nap - I'm the [Root.GetTitle], they won't protest!
I'll pretend to listen while admiring the scenery.
Actually, according to the treatise written by...
\n\nYou correct the scholars and impress them with your knowledge.

An ancient marble statue of a man was discovered buried in the wilderness. According to various scholars' assertions, it was perhaps made before the Event. Regardless, perhaps you would like to keep this statue for yourself?
Those chiseled muscles... I like them....
I am not interested in keeping this false idol!
It'd be a fitting decoration in one of my rooms.
I want to spend some time studying this statue.
The elders are telling me stories about the foreign peoples who came to Caribbean many centuries ago, in ancient times. The ones that interest me the most are the...
the whitemen
the blackmen
the brownmen
the redmen
The elders are telling me stories about the barbarians who interacted with the Holy Columbian Confederacy. The ones that interest me the most are the...
the Antiquarians
the Snakemen
the Fetishists
the Floridamen
The elders are telling me stories about the foreigners who interacted with the Californians. The ones that interest me the most are the...
the Tree Huggers
the Sand Doves
the Yimbies
the Rock Doves

High in a mountainous part of your realm, there are ancient ruins built of rock and stone. Perhaps it was once a shrine, or someone's house, or an ancient fortress. Though much of it has fallen apart, some of it is still remarkably preserved and recently, these ruins have become increasingly popular among shepherds, trade caravans, and other travelers as a resting location, and there are proposals to improve it by building an inn. Besides the inn, we can also build...
Never mind. We don't have the resources at this time.
A house of worship for the faithful.
An additional wing for the inn.
A military outpost to protect the area.

While on patrol recently in the mountains, a few of your soldiers got lost. Miraculously, they all survived with no major injuries. What more, they stumbled on an ancient cache buried deep in a small mountain shrine that must have been untouched for centuries, if not longer. They present their findings to you.
Excellent, excellent!
Split some of it with the soldiers - that's only fair.
Let the soldiers have it all, for they found it.

I am sightseeing a part of my realm today. Having journeyed far, I and several of my companions are weary and tired. We spot some ruins in the distance. They are decrepit, but enough for us to rest in. I make myself comfortable, leaning a smooth, carved stone, and as I fall asleep I mutter to myself:
What an impressive sight this place must have been...
It Was Beautiful

A man I do not recognize approaches me. "It was an impressive sight," he tells me with authority. "It was, many centuries ago, when it was my home."

I ask him, "You lived here?"

Suddenly, the landscape before me changes! The ruins disappear, and instead I see a magnificent building in a style I do not recognize, surrounded by a spectacular landscape. The man gestures, and answers, "I did, and it was beautiful."

I admire the scenery for some time, before I gradually wake up and find myself back in the ruins. The man from my dream is nowhere to be seen.
And what a dream that was!

By [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]! A handsome man in our town at last! the barmaid says, blushing and smiling as you enter the tavern. You are here to meet a few local patricians on official business, but it will be at least an hour or so before they arrive, so perhaps you can distract myself with this girl...
She's obviously saying that to get tips. Ignore her.
Have a friendly chat with her, but nothing inappropriate.
Flirt with her, but not too seriously.
One hour is enough for a bit of fun...
I'm not interested in women anyways.

I am at a small feast, hosted by a local nobleman. One of his children, a charming [Root.GetBoyGirlOpp], tries to make small talk with me, and coyly says, "It's a fine day with you around...." This [Root.GetBoyGirlOpp] is clearly inexperienced at conversing with [Root.GetHerHisOpp] betters, but it is endearing. As the two of you continue talking, I see that [Root.GetSheHeOpp] perhaps has some potential.
Give [Root.GetHerHim] some advice and kind words.
This is boring. I'll find someone else to talk to.
I'll suggest to [Root.GetHerHisOpp] father that [Root.GetSheHeOpp] could join my court.
It will undoubtedly offer better opportunities than living in this small mansion forever.

A strange mercenary has come to my court from faraway lands. She is a woman, for one thing. Though not too old, she bears a number of battle wounds, and her demeanor suggests she is tough as nails. She tells me, if a bit ominously, "Death is my art, and like all artists, I seek a patron. For a mere handful of gold, I will follow you into any danger."
She's an unconventional sort, but hire her anyways!
No, that's fine. Thank her for the offer nevertheless.
Hah! A woman thinks she can actually fight?

I am visiting some of the peasants nearby, to better gauge how things are going in my realm, or at least to pretend I care. I ask one of them how they expect the next harvest to go. "There's a nip in the air," the farmer says in his rustic dialect. "Cold won't be good for my crops."
Not my problem, so good luck with that.
Don't worry. Things will be fine. I promise you!
Pray to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] that nothing happens.
I see. Let's hope the cold won't be that bad.

The village market is always a bustling place. While waiting for someone, I idly watch people. From earnest farmers selling and buying produce to crafty merchants from exotic lands, there are so many here. I notice there is a little girl working at the stall next to me, so I ask her what she is doing here. "I sell fruits and vegetables with my mother. It's fun most days but hard work."
Better get used to a life of hard work, kid.
That's the wrong attitude! Sometimes you have to relax.
Work is pointless without the help of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
You're admirable! Maybe there is hope for the future after all.

You're bored one day and getting to know one of your guards, a friendly fellow who's also something of an amateur poet. "You know what's wrong with the world these days? Everyone is obsessed with death. People have forgotten humor, poetry and romance. I love a good sword fight as much as the next man, but there's more to life."
We can't let frivolous follies distract us, though.
You're just a lazy loafer, aren't you?
True enough words! People need to relax.
I like your attitude! Would you like a promotion?

In the hills of [Root.Capital.GetName], there are some mining operations that bring in much needed profit to the local towns. While visiting one such mining town I learn about its most peculiar arrangement. The town's two mines are owned by a married couple, except they are business rivals. Thus, husband and wife each own one mine and compete against each other.
The townsfolk say they constantly bicker.
How are they still married?

Somehow, years ago, the husband and wife had a falling out, and are now trying to drive each other out of business. This absurd situation confounds and troubles the townspeople, but given the profits the mines bring in, they decide to live with it. Now, however, with my coming, the husband and wife demand that I support one of them in favor of the other. On one hand, there is no legal need for me to get involved in their bizarre squabble. On the other hand, it's clear the husband and wife still care about each other and they're just too proud to believe otherwise, not to mention I could gain some sort of financial benefit from this too by getting a good business deal with one of them.
The husband seems more reliable than his shrewish wife.
The wife seems sharper than her oafish husband.
Perhaps I can resolve their marital troubles.
I think I can work out a profitable arrangement with both.
Why should I get involved with this?

A maid is helping me clean out my room. She is infamous for having a sarcastic and occasionally absent-minded personality, even if she is quite capable and undyingly loyal. I hand her a few things to put in the garbage dump, and she rolls her eyes and says sarcastically, "I am sworn to carry your burdens."
Don't talk such rot. I am your liege!
Ha ha! Funny as always!
I need more sharp, witty people like you at court.
I don't trust those who use insincere smiles and dishonest flattery.

I come across a peasant on the road and try to talk with him. "Come to gawk at a [Root.Culture.GetName] commoner?" he snaps, before quickly apologizing, "I mean no offense. I am but a humble farmer. Not a... a great [Root.GetTitle], like you."
No worries. Are you doing alright?
Insolent wretch! I was trying to be friendly!
Guards, beat this man to teach him a lesson.
Guards, imprison this vile knave!

Today you are in town and paying a visit to someone, and overhear an elderly gentleman saying, "The security in [Root.Capital.GetName] is terrible. Shameful, that's what it is." He then continues to criticize your guards and your decisions in regard to protecting the region, without noticing you are right there!
Ignore him.
Reveal myself and apologize for my errors.
Reveal myself and discuss what he thinks should be done.
Reveal myself and politely tell him to mind his business.

You and a few guards are traveling in the more rural parts of the country, when you come across a man sitting by an overturned carriage. He appears to be in pain, and explains he is a traveling merchant. Bandits attacked him and took all his goods. However, he still has some left belongings at his camp nearby. If you escorted him back to his camp, he will compensate you.
Sure! Always glad to lend a hand.
You're on your own, stranger.
Something seems fishy. We should leave.
Something seems fishy. Let's help, but be on your guard, men.
You agree to help the merchant.

The merchant happily leads you back to his camp at a surprisingly brisk pace. Once you approach the camp, however, you realize there are heavily armored men around. The ‘merchant' shouts to the men, "Looks like we've got ourselves another fool!"
You and your men fought off the bandits and escaped.
You and your men fought the bandits and killed them all.

How can a river be shaped like that?

I stand on a stage, but one unlike any other I've ever seen before. It is immense in size, more like the throne room of a faraway Emperor. There are bright lights high above, a hundred suns that blind me to the audience below. But even in this dream, I know that I must perform music here. Yet I cannot play. My dream self remembers a painful memory from the past.
I sorrowfully watch my instrument.
It is an organ of the oddest shape, I've never seen before. It is both black and white, and its majesty beckons to me. And yet I cannot.
Music of Love

Far away, at the edge of the stage, hidden behind the curtains, [Root.GetSheHeOpp] stands. "You can do it!" [Root.GetSheHeOpp] mouths to me. "I believe in you!"

I approach the black and white organ with trepidation. Can I still play now, even after what happened back then?

But I must, if only for [Root.GetHerHimOpp].

I sit before the organ, and begin to play.
After waking up, I can still hear the song I played in my head.

I am lost in a maze of tunnels that never seem to end. No matter where I turn, right or left, I cannot find a way out. No matter where I go, there is no one here. I thought there might have been monsters or bandits lurking about, but my only friends and enemies are the flickers of the occasional torch and the cold stone walls. Nothing exists but the dark passageways.
I wake up, sweating, with a feeling of unease.

I wander a field that stretches from horizon to horizon, lost. I travel for what seems like years upon years and find no sense of direction, and I grow scared. I beg for some respite. Suddenly, on the horizon, I see something approaching me - a woman dressed in an ethereal dress like clouds in the sky, atop a pale horse. She gazes at me with a neutral expression, and I ask her where I am, and where is the nearest town. She does not speak, but merely points in a certain direction, before riding off and disappearing.
I follow her directions.

Some time later - I do not know how long - the faint image of a village appears. Hurrah! It is just as that mysterious woman pointed to me!\n\nAs I wake up from my strange dream, I can only think of one thing.
Who was that lady?

He wanders the universe atop his mighty steed, aimlessly, as far as our mortal minds can comprehend. Finally, I meet this figure in my dream, whose appearance and purpose I cannot truly grasp. When I talk or gesture to him, all he does is nod sagely and point towards something far away. I try to reach towards the destination he indicated, but before I arrive, I wake up.
Who was that man, and where did he tell me to go?

There is a very small but thriving group of Chinese shoemakers living nearby. They ask for your support to help them build a small shrine to the ancient Chinese warlord Liu Bei, who, despite being a distant scion of the Han Dynasty, had humble beginnings as a shoemaker. They say Liu Bei was a virtuous and steadfast man, traits that surely reflect your great rule too.
Good luck with that. I'm sure you don't need my help.
I can provide a bit of monetary aid.
I will take the lead in making their dreams become reality.

I recently provided protection to a small group of Chinese envoys and travelers in my territory. During their journey, they were attacked by ruthless bandits, but my brave men held them off. In gratitude, one my Chinese guests offered a colorful statue of Guan Yu that is an old family heirloom. Guan Yu was an ancient Chinese general who had been deified as a God of War.
This demonic statue cannot stay with me!
Thank them but politely reject their offer.
Put the statue somewhere suitable in my home.

A Chinese traveler and poet, who lives in the nearby wilderness, visits my court today, and recites some poetry he recently made. It is stylistically inspired by the poetry of the Three Caos - the great warlord and ruler Cao Cao, and his sons Cao Pi and Cao Zhi - who were influential poets in their day. After he performs it for you, he asks what you think.
That was bad.
Very good!
I like it so much, I'll offer him a place at my court.

You meet a wanderer from a land far away, who recently traveled to the far east. He asks you to regale him with interesting stories from his travels, and in the middle of his account, he tells of a popular Chinese saying he heard: "Brothers are like limbs, wives and children are like clothing. Torn clothing can be repaired, but how can broken limbs be mended?"
Siblings are more important than wives or children.
How terrible! Our children are our future!
Disagreed. Wives are important, we should respect them.

Lately, I have been reading about the heroes and villains of the Three Kingdoms, that era of disunity and conflict in China when the Han Dynasty collapsed into civil war. For centuries, people have told many stories, some more fantastical than others, about the deeds and exploits of this fascinating cast of characters. I in particular have an admiration for the...
Warlords who sought to create order from chaos.
Generals who bravely fought on the battlefield.
Strategists who determined the fates of many.
Noblewomen who were influential in their own ways.

The Empire, once united, must divide. Once divided, must unite. Thus had it always been with Chinese history. In that era of disunity, the Three Kingdoms, plenty of powerful, ambitious leaders sought to reunite China, some virtuous, some unscrupulous. There is one in particular I find very inspiring:
Cao Cao - cunning and cultured
Liu Bei - just and benevolent
Sun Quan - hardworking and proud
Dong Zhuo - tyrannical and merciless

Many are the names of the generals from the Three Kingdoms period. Whether with blade or spear or halberd or bow, whether on foot or on horseback, it was these men's daring and courage that determined the course of battles - and the course of history. My favorite general happens to be:
Righteous Guan Yu, who became a God of War
Fiery Zhang Fei, deathly loyal to Liu Bei's cause
One-eyed Xiahou Dun, humble soldier of Cao Cao
Ruthless Lu Bu, the treacherous but unmatched Flying General

The strategists, through their manipulations and complex mind games, are the ones who truly hold the power to shape the course of history. Whether it is choosing battle tactics or contemplating administrative policies, they left their mark on the turbulent times of the Three Kingdoms. My favorite is:
Zhuge Liang, the peerless sleeping dragon
Sima Yi, the calculating politician
Zhou Yu, the cultured youth
Chen Gong, the doomed gentleman

Though it was usually men who fought each other in the arenas of battle and politics during the age of the Three Kingdoms, many women also fought in their own ways as well. Even heaven must know of their stories of hardship, dedication, and bravery, even if many people do not. There are quite a number, but the one I respect the most is:
Diaochan, who sacrificed herself for a nation
Sun Shangxiang, courageous and skilled in the martial arts
Qiao sisters, the two charming and talented beauties
Huang Yueying, who had an unsurpassed mind

The Center of Islam was lost years ago, following a period of intense religious turnmoil. Today, it still remains in infidel hands. Perhaps one day, a valiant and noble king shall conquer this city in the name of true religion.
Perhaps it shall be so.
Detroit's walls are too mighty. Is it even possible?
There're more important things out there than a distant dream.
If I had the opportunity and resources, I could conquer the city!

Some of Gothamite merchants based in Charleston have recently gotten into a number of conflicts with local Dixie administrators and Gothamite noblemen. They argue they need your support to ensure a steady flow of trade in your demesne, while the men under your command argue the Gothamites cannot be trusted. It is up to you to intervene in their disputes, lest it grows out of hand.
Support the Gothamites. We need their business.
Support the local notables. We must be cautious with outsiders.
Support neither - let them sort this out on their own!
Invite a Gothamite merchant to my court as a representative.
That way, we'll have clearer lines of communication. If I and my officials know what the Italians want, it'll be easier to negotiate with them or even manipulate them to our ends!

An acquaintance recently returned from a trip to Sacramento. They regale you with tales of the wonders and splendor of the great city, and you listen with eager ears. There are many stories that you would like to hear about, many things you wish to learn, and in particular, you are most interested in learning about the…
Dark depths of court intrigue and politics in the ancient city
Pleasure to be had with its courtesans and entertainers
Trade that flows from all corners of the world
Daily lives of its inhabitants, from high nobles to humble commoners

I have heard that there are lands far away from where I live, where the practice of marriage between siblings is common and not just accepted, but actively embraced and encouraged. Could such places even exist? If they did, I have yet to meet anyone from them in person.
Absolutely barbaric! Degenerates!
Who am I to judge? Different people have different customs.
Thinking about them gets me all excited.
I don't think they exist, made up by some pervert without a sister.
Perhaps they are true followers of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Have you heard of the flying rabbits of the far north? my servant asks me one day, while we are conversing about various matters. "Fascinating creatures! Do you think they're real?"
Don't be silly. Rabbits don't fly, nor live in the frozen north.
Who knows? It's certainly a possibility!
You're confusing them with a real creature known as the...
You're confusing them with a real creature known as the...

A traveler is regaling me with a tale he heard when he was visiting a town one day. "I was told that during Elton times, Eastern Protectorate's governor sent a trusted friend and advisor as a diplomat to the eastern lands, but he got lost in the desert not too far from where I stayed. He finally found a large oasis, where people still behaved like the Old World people, building Old World building and worshipping ancient gods, and they had all knowledge of the Old World."
I'm sure they were merely some troglodytic peasants.
Would these hidden oases still be around today?

Ah! Let me tell you a story, the merchant says, after we finish with business. Not one to anger my jolly guest, we sit down as we feast and he tells me what he heard when he sailed not too long ago. "I was told that if one sails west, one would eventually reach a the islands of Avachumbi and Ninachumbi, a large island ruled by towering men who ride steeds of solid gold. These people of the Sun are most intelligent and mighty and ruled by the Golden King."
Fascinating people! Maybe one day we'll meet them.
I'm not convinced they exist.

An acquaintance tells me that she heard if one digs underground deep enough, one will emerge in another world where there are people similar to ours. However, they are the opposite of us - their women are taller than their men, the men stay at home and manage domestic affairs while the women fight wars, and most scandalously, siblings can wed one another. Still, my acquaintance said she heard this land was mostly peaceful and prosperous.
Perhaps their strange ways are why they're prosperous and peaceful.
Really now! What kind of society like that could exist?
How exciting! My imagination is trying to envision such a place.

Someone tells me of a king in a faraway land who was cruel, yet fair in his dealings. Once, he hired an engineer to create the largest labyrinth the world has ever known. Those guilty of the worst crimes are put in this maze of tunnels and hallways. Almost none escape, but there are always a few who have the wits and tenacity, and the king grants these few their freedom.
Someone capable enough to escape deserves freedom, yes.
A strange ruler! Such unnecessary and outlandish methods.
I hope his labyrinth is full of monsters and death traps!

I have heard rumors about a noble and valiant warrior woman in a distant land, who is immortal and stands guard over an ancient gate made of marble and obsidian. Those who best her in combat will be allowed into the gate, which is a portal to a heavenly paradise, a most peaceful and pastoral landscape one can live in with no worries nor fears. If it did exist, could I go there?
If only I could go to such a place, I'd be so happy.
I'm sure I could beat that woman and gain entry.
I don't need it. I have all I need here.

I meet a local village elder, a wizened old man, who was a foolhardy adventurer in his youth. He once got lost in a great forest, and almost drowned in its swamps. He was rescued by a mysterious man who referred to himself only as a dreamer and who warned about the seductive dangers of excitement and risk. Afterwards, the old man lived a stable, quiet, happy life back home.
Agreed! Only idiots blindly worship excitement and ambition.
I disagree. What's the point of living a boring life?
Wait a moment... did you meet the Dreamer?

Among the nomad peoples of America, there are stories of an immortal horse, forever racing across the great steppes, free and bold. The galloping of the mighty steed's hooves sound like thunder, and it is faster than anything one could see.
Maybe one day I shall see it!
A fanciful tale, nothing more.

I have a guard who once visited a distant village by a forest said to be a gateway to the world beyond. He went in the forest despite the locals' warning. There, he encountered a pale maiden wearing a white dress. Though she was charming and bashful, he fled immediately, knowing this must have been a frightening spirit of some sort. The locals said such sightings are common.
What a coward! She couldn't have been a spirit.
Frightening things lie beyond the fringes of civilization!

My new maid is a strange woman. Her father was a merchant, and she accompanied him on his journeys. She claims when she was little, they visited a forested land when she got lost in the woods at night. A mysterious woman found her sobbing, and guided her back to the main road. The woman barely spoke and merely said she was a dreamer, and disappeared soon after.
A strange encounter!
Wait - you met the Dreamer, didn't you!

I am hosting a prominent local scholar. Contrary to my expectations of him being an awkward, doddering old man, he is rather young, handsome, and charismatic. As we talk, he tells me about a large lake in my realm. He once visited it, but almost drowned when he tried taking a swim. When he came to, he found himself on one of the lake's islands he never saw before.
What happened next?
He describes its geography, and I do not recall a lake on such an island either. Very mysterious!
Lost Island

The scholar circled the shore of the island and came across an old temple built by the ancients, yet still in good condition despite being abandoned. There, he quickly prayed to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. Afterwards, to his surprise, he found a small boat near the temple which he used to leave the island.\n\nEvery time he returned to the lake, he could never find the island again. No one has heard of an island on that lake with its characteristics and geography, and it isn't mentioned in local legends, and his fellow scholars have not found a trace of it in historical records.
There must have been something strange afoot.
Perhaps the whole thing was a dream?
Will I find the island one day? Who knows what secrets it holds!

I appear to have interrupted a heated debate. A courtiers have been discussing rumors they heard about a distant land known as the Isle of Colors, where men and women are like us, except for one thing: their skin is an unnatural color. What my courtiers cannot seem to agree on, however, is what that skin color is. Perhaps I can provide my input on the matter?
The Isle of Colors does not exist. Someone made it up.
Their skin's true color is pink - at least, that's what I think.
I'd say surely dark blue is their skin's natural hue!
I'd guess their skin is green, though this I have not seen.
