When my official put the stamp of approval on the document, the ink got smudged. It still looks recognizable, but it does not look neat at all. On the other hand, rewriting the entire document would mean a waste of time that could be spent elsewhere, as it is a very big document.
Rewrite it. We don't want any misunderstandings.
It is alright - leave it as it is.
We spent all day looking for the lost document in the piles of papers and scrolls, but alas, it could not be found. It was an important document too!
What are we going to do now?

A local official of yours was accused of corruption. He confessed to being seduced by a young, unmarried noblewoman who asked him to overlook some illegal activities her brother partook in. He has subsequently fined and punished the wrongdoer brother, but he still allowed himself to get into this mess in the first place, not to mention he says he is still in love with the lady.
All's well that ends well! Give my blessings for their marriage.
Fine the official and tell him not to do it again.
Imprison the official. What he did was wrong.
Execute the official! Such weakness is unacceptable.

You've heard about one of your lesser officials who is rumored to be incorruptible. Fascinated, you visit him incognito one day, pretending to be a typical nobleman. You offer him bribes of all sorts, promises of fame and glory, and beautiful women, but he seems unmoved. Finally, when you reveal yourself, he still remains unmoved, calmly saying he was merely doing his job.
Why doesn't he treat me more special than others?
Good to see I have dependable people working for me.
How admirable! Reward him for his efforts.
I need someone like him by my side at court.
I've misplaced some critical documents and will have to meet with some officials soon about issues related to those documents. What am I going to do?
I'm the [Root.GetTitle], they won't dare to reprimand me.
Admit my mistake and promise to make up for it.
Make up some excuse - my horse ate the documents.
Pretend I'm sick so I won't have to meet them.
You notice a stain on a scroll you're reading. The blotch is awfully distracting. What could have caused it?
Gross! I don't want to touch that scroll now.
It's probably just water or juice.

I am receiving some envoys and notice that I am standing a few inches behind where I should ideally stand, if I wanted to follow proper court etiquette and protocol. I take a small step forward to prevent a faux pas.
That was a close one!
I sneezed in the middle of a meeting with my counselors. No one said "bless you" to me, as if they did not notice!
It's no matter.
No one cares about me.
This makes me angry!

It's our policy - we can't go against it, you overhear one of your bureaucrats explaining to another.\n\nThe other bureaucrat frowns. "If we do it that way, we'll waste a lot of time. The commoners are depending on us to help them."
Continue walking along.
Tell them following policy is important.
Tell them to ignore the rules for now.

One of your minor officials has accused his superior of refusing to promote or reward him. Upon investigation, you find this minor official to be extremely talented and capable. However, when you discuss this with his superior, the senior official says this minor official came from an inferior, lesser background - his mother was once a whore! - so he needs to know his place.
Good point! Merit is nothing compared to lineage.
I disagree. The minor official will be promoted.
I'm sure they'll sort out their differences eventually.
If he's underappreciated, I'll have him work directly for me.

While holding court, I suddenly recall something extremely embarrassing and shameful I did years ago. No matter how hard I try, the memories gnaw at my consciousness and sense of decency, and I have to fight hard to ensure I don't turn into a sobbing wreck. I can't believe I did it back then - what was I thinking?
My stupid mind! Curse you for remembering!
Ignore it, ignore it, ignore it, ignore it!
Actually it was pretty funny.
Lightning struck really close to me, but thankfully nothing happened!
I was really lucky.

I am visiting a village in my realm on some business. Before I leave, I stop by an herbalist's shop on a whim. I never realized there were so many different kinds of herbs, plants, minerals, and so on that one could use to make potions and poisons! The herbalist, an older woman with a stern face, looked annoyed at me for mindlessly loitering, but said nothing.
Can I purchase some for my physicians to use?
I just wanted to browse for fun.
This is probably useless quack medicine anyways.

A wild wolf was spotted wandering near where you live. It does not appear to be an immediate danger to anyone, but no one knows what to do with it. Whenever you are nearby, it seems to stay back and stare at you with a serious expression, as if it were showing some sign of respect.
Order my soldiers to chase it away. It's a danger.
If it wishes to stick around, I shall respect it.

You were retiring for the night when you saw a most alarming sight on your bed: a single dagger, coated in blood. An investigation did not turn up any information as to who put it there and why. A few of your courtiers and guards suggest it may have been a prank.
This is concerning! Increase security immediately!
Maybe it was a prank indeed.
Even if it wasn't a prank, I laugh in the face of danger!
That's not blood. It's colored water.

I am inspecting my troops today in their camps. I walk by some smiths, who are in the middle of repairing some weapons and armor. Everyone says they work hard to ensure my warriors are outfitted with the best gear.
Their hard work shall not be in vain.
Those lazy bums should be working harder!
The blacksmiths of [Root.GetName] have gained renowned in recent years for the quality of their craft. This surely bodes well for their livelihoods, and for the local economy!
Good to hear!

I attended a ball at a local nobleman's house, and met a most interesting person. We talked about all sorts of things and had a great time. Unfortunately they had to leave early, and I didn't even get their name!
Who was that?
I dreamt of traveling to a magnificent, mighty castle, so large and immense it towered over everything in nearby territory, even the forests and the mountains. It was an imposing sight!
When I woke up, I wondered what it was all about.

There are those who say Brazil, the Pindorama, is the most civilized of nations, that its laws are the most just, its officials the most righteous, its land the most prosperous, its people the most virtuous, its culture the most refined. Surely this must be true!
We should be proud of our [Root.Culture.GetName] ways too.
Indeed, we should learn from them.
They are no better than anyone else!

A prominent nobleman was recently injured severely, and a physician was called to perform an emergency surgery on him. However, the nobleman died nevertheless. Some of the nobleman's relatives claimed the physician botched the procedure, but the physician and other learned men claim the surgery had a low chance of success to begin with. They come to you for judgment.
The physician did it on purpose, imprison him!
The physician made a mistake, but is innocent. He will pay a fine.
The physician did his best. The family should drop the case.
The physician did nothing wrong. The injury the nobleman had...

A notorious criminal recently escaped my prisons and afterwards went on a murder spree. He was subsequently captured and immediately executed by my guards on the spot, but this will undoubtedly be a stain on my authority.
Terrible news!

They say a benevolent spirit resides in a small forest in [Root.GetName]. There are many stories circulating about how it has protected children that got lost in the woods at night, or how it helped hunters defeat dangerous predators.
Let us hope it continues to protect the locals.
On your way somewhere, you pass by a hill near a small village, and notice a young man and woman playing with their child. They look happy together, enjoying each other's company.
That warms my heart. They seem like good people.
Seeing happy people makes me irrationally irritable.
One of your maids reported that one of your courtiers left an inappropriate love letter on her bed. She appeals to you to do something about it.
This is her problem, not mine.
I will give him a stern talking to.

A powerful nobleman living nearby has approached you with a complaint. Some locals are constructing some new buildings near his house. However, the noise they make is loud and annoying. It is technically on their property, so he can't do anything about it, but perhaps you can.
Nobles should be respected! Halt construction immediately.
The locals aren't breaking any laws, so they can continue.
I will discuss with the locals on how they can reduce the noise.

They say a mad alchemist or wizard lives in [Root.GetName], dabbling in dangerous, arcane arts such as trying to find the potion to immortality, or pillaging graves for the bodies of dead maidens to sate his unnatural desires. It is said in his hut are thousands of profane scrolls and potions. However, no such madman can be found anywhere, according to the official authorities.
He must be somewhere!
The peasants are just imagining things again.
Your soldiers accidentally burst into the wrong person's house to make an arrest. It was an awkward situation all around.
At least no one was hurt.
Pay that person a bit of money as an apology.

I am hearing tales of the barbarian warlords who attacked the Rome generations ago. Attila of course is the most famous, but others are also well known such as Alaric, who sacked Rome yet died soon after, or Genseric, who transformed the Vandals into a Mediterranean power, or the ambitious Odoacer, who overthrew the last Western Roman Emperor, Romulus Augustulus.
Attila was like the coming of the apocalypse!
Alaric's sacking of Rome is legendary in its brutality.
Genseric's daring and cunning is underrated in these annals.
Odoacer has earned his place in history for his deed.

he gold and salt mines of Andes are many, and bring forth much wealth to the region. Yet there are rumors, legends and stories, about how beyond the mountain and jungles, there are even wealthier kingdoms and cities that make the Andean lords look impoverished by comparison. Could such places exist?
Surely not. The Andean kingdoms are rich beyond measure.
I think they do exist! The world out there is vast.
Who could possibly be richer than the [Root.Culture.GetName] people?

A noted scholar living nearby was known to have possessed an ancient scroll with indecipherable writing. He says he has a feeling that it is a hoax. However, there are those you know who claim it is actually a dark artifact capable of foul magic, and that it should be destroyed.
Destroy that scroll! It could be dangerous!
I wouldn't mind taking a look - it is harmless!
Why does this matter to me?
Let's show this to other scholars, see what they think.

It was my first time at that tavern. I only came there to visit a member of the local elites, but the tavern's staff and regulars greeted me warmly and presented a gift of a simple but beautifully carved wooden bowl as a souvenir. It's not the usual thing a great [Root.GetTitle] would use, but it is mine to keep, if I so wish.
Of course, I appreciate it.
No thanks! This is worthless!
There is a pewter spoon I am very fond of. Even though it is not the most dignified looking thing, maybe I should use it more regularly just in case.
A good idea.
There are better spoons out there.
I found a solid measuring rod, made of hardy stone. It could come in handy in the future, and help me with a variety of tasks and matters.
Even for someone of my status, it is good to have around.
I am not a lowly commoner playing with tools.

A wonderful flower vase, for a wonderful [Root.GetTitle], the merchant says, before presenting a luxurious looking flower vase. It is definitely of higher quality and better than the average flower vase! Should you buy it?
Yes, I should!
No, I should not.
I have acquired a leather knapsack for holding things. It's not the most beautiful thing ever made, but the craftsman who made it certainly designed it to have a rustic, simplistic charm.
Who knows how it could help me?
This is rubbish, give it a servant or dispose of it.

One of my guards recently got lost in the desert. Thankfully, it wasn't for long and he made it back to civilization safely. However, while he was in the desert, he came across a small ancient ruin, where he found a most interesting small statue. It was clearly made by the ancients, and he asks me if I want to keep it.
Certainly. It looks beautiful.
No, it's all yours, since you found it.

A peasant was digging near her house, doing the typical farm work peasants do, when she hit something hard. She investigated and found that it was a sculpted stone head of a mustached man. When she brought it to you, your wisest scholars said it did not resemble the art of any known peoples, and they suggested that perhaps it was the work of an ancient civilization.
I will keep it, thanks.
I will keep it, but compensate the peasant.
The peasant lady can keep it for herself.
Throw it away! It was clearly made by demon worshippers!
Some merchants I am acquainted with wished to offer me a present. It turned out to be a weighing scale, made with fine materials.
This will surely be useful!
I don't need that, but thank you nonetheless.

You came across a hammer one day, and like how firm it feels in your hand. Though you are not a common craftsman, you can't help but admire this hammer. After all, aren't buildings, ships, and other great constructs made with such a simple thing? Perhaps even a great [Root.GetTitle] like you might have a use for it one day.
I will keep it by my side.
It is interesting, but nothing more.

I recently needed to repair part of my residence, so I hired some laborers to do the job. While I was inspecting their work, I noticed one man had a particularly fascinating shovel with him. Despite its simplicity and crudeness, it clearly displayed a sturdiness and power not typically seen in such a simple tool. The laborer, seeing my admiration for it, says I can keep it if I want.
That sounds splendid. Thank you!
No thanks, I just wanted a look.

I met a merchant specializing in beautiful works of art that would be excellent as home decorations. He showed me one particular painting he thought I might be interested in: a simple depiction of a lovely lake surrounded by fertile land, all under a beautiful, clear blue sky.
I will buy it!
I am not interested.
You notice the merchant's shop has a painting of an ancient ruin, surrounded by beautiful wildlands. You asked if it was for sale, and the merchant said it could certainly be yours for a good price.
Good. I will purchase it.
I was merely curious, but am not interested in buying.

The artist shows me one of their works: a gorgeous painting of a forest, full of lush vegetation that appears so real, it looks as if one could step into the painting and enter the world it depicts. Perhaps if I were to pay a decent price, the artist would sell it to me.
Make an offer they can't refuse.
On the other hand, I don't want it anymore.

A hunter in my realm went out hunting one day when he stumbled on a hole. Curious, he dug deeper, and found some ancient artifacts. Most were useless and broken, save for a flute made from what appears to be the bone of a giant creature or man. When the hunter presented it to me, he showed me how it could still play music - it sounded pleasant, if melancholy and strange.
Thank you for your kind gift.
No thanks - it looks dangerous and evil.
I can see the mountains from my home on a regular basis. It recently snowed a little up there, and I can see the peaks of the mountains capped with a clear layer of white.
A majestic and inspiring sight!

I was traveling at night with a group of people. "We must move with haste, or else they'll catch us!" someone said.\n\nSuddenly, there was screams and fire. "Ambush! Run for it!" someone shouts. Too late - the next thing I knew, I was hit with  several arrows.
Then I woke up. What a nightmare!

Unsavory bandits blackmailed the orphaned, young nobleman into making a number of deals with them, which they of course reneged on. They decided they wanted to kill him and tried to storm his residence, but with luck and some quick thinking, the man managed to escape his enemies. Now he comes to you, begging for your protection.
I can afford to send a few guards to take care of these criminals.
This is not my problem. Figure this out on your own!
Stay at my court, where you will be safe.

Unnerving news from [Root.GetName]. There was a village there that was relatively prosperous and sizeable. However, recently, all of its inhabitants simply vanished. People from nearby settlements organized search parties, and even some of your local officials went to investigate the matter, but no one from that village was ever found. Now, all that remains is the wind whistling through the village, dark, abandoned, and lifeless.
What on earth happened to that village?

Two commoners from powerful local families recently wed in [Root.GetName] - the groom a handsome, intelligent, virtuous youth, and the bride a beautiful, clever, gentle maiden. The two were apparently friends as children, and the match a perfect and blissful one. During the wedding, to the amazement of all, the clouds appeared in the shape of various good omens, and some claim that they heard sounds and voices from heaven above blessing this marriage!
Interesting news.
I was playing outside with one of my friends from the village, running around and laughing, with not a care in the world.
Suddenly, [Root.GetSheHeOpp] looks up.
\n\nWhat is it?
It begins raining out of nowhere, and within seconds the drizzle turns into a raging storm. "Hurry!" [Root.GetSheHeOpp] calls to me
We rush to find cover under a large boulder.
That was a close one!
We huddle under the boulder, waiting for the rain to stop. The storm clears up about an hour later, but I realize my friend has fallen asleep, [Root.GetHerHisOpp] head resting on my shoulder!
Let [Root.GetHerHisOpp] sleep... [Root.GetSheHeOpp] looks angelic.
Gently wake [Root.GetHerHisOpp] up.
Prank [Root.GetHerHisOpp] to make [Root.GetHerHisOpp] wake up.

The rain fell harder earlier today, but now it has lessened to a light drizzle, so you and a few courtiers go outside to experience the fresh air. [target_VIET_rain_puddle_dancer.GetTitledName] suddenly starts hopping around in one of the puddles like a child, laughing and splashing around.
Stop that now! How immature!
That looks fun, but I'll stay out.
Let me join in!
It is raining heavily today. I sit by the window, gazing outside.
This weather is so depressing.
I love rain - it is so healing.

A large cistern was discovered in [Root.GetName]. It seems to have been used by ancient peoples to collect rainwater, and as it is still in relatively good condition, the locals plan to refurbish and reuse it. Perhaps we can lend some funds to help them in this endeavor? The economic and social benefits would be considerable.
Great idea! Lend them some financial support.
I will fully fund their efforts.
I have no interest in helping.
Today it is raining, yet the sun is still shining!
Amazing sight!
Last night the rain was so heavy a part of my house collapsed and flooded. I will now have to dedicate some funds to fixing and restoring the mess.
As if I didn't have enough problems.
In parts of [Root.GetName], colorful rain was reported to have fallen for several days. After some deliberation, locals consider this to be a good omen of things to come.
Good to hear.
In parts of [Root.GetName], colorful rain was reported to have fallen for several days. After some deliberation, locals consider this to be a bad omen of things to come.
Oh no....

The book I read looked like a typical vapid romance at first. Instead, it was an epic love story with drama, comedy and tragedy, that raised poignant, difficult questions about human morality and mortality. Immensely moved, I now find it hard to fall asleep at night as I think about the characters I'd grown to love and their bittersweet fates. Will I ever read a story like that again?
I never expected to like that kind of story in the first place!

I was watching a play a traveling troupe was performing. Though it was a short and simple love story without much drama or conflict, the characters were likeable and realistic in their motivations and desires. Despite its simplicity and lack of tension, many in the audience loved the story.
Those plebians - it's just some banal fluff!
I admit, it brought a smile to my face.
A poet is reciting a tale about a historical event long ago before me and an audience. I realize he just made a mistake, and there are some inaccuracies in his retelling of what happened!
Don't say anything.
Correct him - history should not be lies!
Correct him - the true history is more interesting.
Correct him - I want to show off my knowledge.

The book you are reading is dense and full of complex ideas about philosophy and the meaning of life. Even though the characters, plot, and setting are interesting, the book itself is an extremely difficult read and you feel like you cannot finish it.
Bear through it - I must discover its meaning!
I give up! I have better things to do.

I was idly reading a book about historical events in ancient times. Suddenly, when I came across a particular section, disjointed images and scenes flashed before my mind, as if I was really there. My servants found me on the ground moments later, having fainted. They were skeptical when I described what happened, but the feelings of sadness, joy, hatred, love - I felt all that!
Was I really there, in the past? Why am I here now?
You recently took the time to read through various books explaining the exploits and deeds of ancient heroes and warriors. It was informative, and helped you to better understand:
Which tactics and strategies work, and which ones don't.
What makes a person brave and able to fight the odds.
How to uphold justice and righteousness among all.

You recently read a touching story about a pure-hearted romance between a young man and woman who had grown up as neighbors and friends. Their virtue and honesty helped them ensure many hardships so they could be united in marriage.
I hate stupid love stories. Why did I read that?
It was an adorable tale about true love.
I see two of my servants on the other side of the room. They are trying to make small talk.
Listen in on the conversation.

Heard any news from the other provinces?
"Nothing I'd like to talk about."
"Bye."
"Bye."
That was really awkward.
That was actually a coded conversation!
They were secretly exchanging gossip about...
You pass by a wayside shrine on the road. You remember one of the locals telling you that praying at these wayside shrines could bring one various kinds of blessings.
Let me pray to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
I need to hurry, I have business to attend to.

A wayshrine in [Root.GetName] has recently gained fame for the blessings it supposedly granted to those who pray at it. Pilgrims and travelers are making their way there in droves, seeking the boons it provides.
Perhaps I should visit there one day.

You are visiting a shop in a town selling various general merchandise on discount, ranging from tableware to rugs and various herbal remedies. It's as if everything's on sale. The shopkeeper tells you, "You don't want the very best. You want cheap. I got cheap."
I like the sound of that! Let me buy some.
You mistake me for a common peasant, good sir!
Just browsing - don't mind me.

I am at an inn for business. While waiting for the other party to arrive, the innkeeper tells me a story about a local alchemist who lived in the area centuries ago and was famed for his abilities. She says he was also a connoisseur of wines, and developed a special kind of wine that could supposedly improve one's eyesight at night, and it was popular among local guards who had night duty. Local lore knows it as the "Shadow Banish." She then offers me a bottle of this famed wine.
Sure, this can't hurt, right?
No thanks! That looks dangerous.
Can I take it back with me?

\n\nYou ended up feeling rather off later that evening, and that night you had a strange dream about waking up with your hands bound in a horse-drawn cart full of prisoners going down a cold, snowy mountain road.
\n\nThough the innkeeper won't sell me the recipe for that wine, I will use my knowledge to see if I can reverse engineer this recipe.

While traveling, my entourage and I come across a circle of burnt, dead trees. It is an unusual sight and curiosity gets the better of us. As we enter this dark grove we see a large rock surrounded by several spikes with skulls skewered on them. On top is a chest filled with many treasures - gold, jewelry, gems, and more. No one has heard of this location, eerily enough.
Let's leave - this place seems cursed.
Take the loot with us!

I meet a local woman who is a renowned dog trainer. Under her expert guidance, she has trained many dogs to be hunters, companions, guards, and more. When I ask her what her secret is, she scoffs and says: "You got your people, and you got your dogs. Dogs are loyal and stupid. People are smart and devious. I'll stick with dogs."
I cannot disagree.
An interesting perspective.
But people can be good too!
I'm here to relieve you, I hear one of my nearby guards say as he takes up his post.\n\n"Another day, another coin," the other one says as he takes his leave.
Their hard work is appreciated.
They are just doing their duty.
Wait a moment... isn't today your day off?

On a visit to a village of my realm, I am talking with a guardsman stationed there. He looks around, eyes fearful, as he tells me: "If you have to travel in these parts, by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] stay on the roads. The wilderness just isn't safe anymore. We've had sightings, you see... the demons."
If demons are about, they're no match for brave men like you.
Hah! Just paranoia. That's ridiculous.
Thanks for letting me know. I'll be careful!
Have you heard any news from the other provinces?

A burly woman appears before my court, claiming to be a knight of some knightly order I have never heard of. A few courtiers wonder if she is just a harlot trying to cheat me, but her scarred and rugged face, and brawny build suggests otherwise. Maybe she is an adventurer?
Tell her to go to fight some bandits.
Haha! A woman thinks she can fight?
Send her off and ignore her.
\n\nShe will chicken out or get herself killed, so either way I think that solves the problem cleverly.

To my surprise, the woman claiming to be a knight returned to my court after having killed all the bandits. I sent a couple soldiers to investigate and they confirmed her claim. Amazing! These bandits had been terrorizing a village in my realm for a couple years now, and none of my soldiers could beat them.
Thank her, but do not reward her. She is untrustworthy.
Reward the woman but tell her to be on her way afterwards.
Reward the woman and praise her valor before the court.

The mysterious woman thanks me for giving her a chance. She admits she is a self-proclaimed knight, but for good reason. Long ago, her close friend was robbed and murdered by bandits. She swore an oath of vengeance, which she seeks to fulfill by fighting bandits and finding a righteous lord to serve. She traveled far and wide, wandering across the world upholding justice and punishing evildoers, but never found a lord worthy of her services until now. If you will accept her, despite her unorthodox origins, then she promises to serve you loyally.
Politely decline her offer and tell her to take her reward and be on her way.
Invite her to join my court and serve me, as she wishes.

A renowned scholar is visiting me today. He is quite a character. When I ask to talk about himself, he tells me: "I'm a retired scholar. Sleep late, read trashy books. I don't keep up with other scholars' affairs anymore. I spent 40 years studying many different topics and teaching at some schools. Good years, but I don't miss it. Now I'm completely useless, and proud of it."
Such a waste of intellect!
It isn't my place to comment on his lifestyle.
Why don't you find purpose by working for me?

I met a most interesting woman at the local tavern, who is quite notorious in her village for her openly blasphemous views. She told me: "They call me the God-Hater. Yes. I hate [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. And any gods worshipped by anyone. They can all bite my garters. And if you don't like it, YOU can bite my garters, too."
This heretic must be punished by the religious authorities!
I do not care about what this bizarre madwoman thinks.
I can't anger the religious authorities, but I can respect a kindred spirit.

There is a widowed noblewoman in a nearby village nicknamed "Runs in Circles" due to her erratic and strange behavior. Though kind and friendly, she went mad years ago. Today, while I passed by this village, she asked me if I had crunchy apples and carrots for her. I told her I did not, and she flew into a panic and ran around in circles continuously screaming "Ni ni ni ni ni!"
I do not have time to deal with this.
The poor woman! I hope she will be fine.
Ha! I like her. Can we invite her to my court?

We came across a ruined stone structure that resembles an ancient fort. Feeling adventurous, we explored it a bit given it wasn't that huge, and we found a chest filled with some gold trinkets and jewelry.
Finders keepers!
We should not take what belongs to the dead of this place.

In my dreams, I came to a village situated atop a tall hill, overlooking a gorgeous lake. There was a big problem: a wizard accidentally turned all the villagers invisible. I helped the wizard fix the problem and the villagers became visible again. As I woke up, I wondered what the deeper meaning of that dream was, if there was one. Surely, the dream was telling me that I need to...
Be truthful to myself and others, right?
Find out that which is hidden and threatens me.
Go out to relax - how beautiful the outside can be!
Nothing. The dream was meaningless. Probably.

In [Root.GetName], there have been several sightings of a supposed giant crab. It is said to hide along beaches and the mudline of rivers, before appearing and terrifying passerby. More skeptical minds believe there is no basis for these claims, as no one has gotten hurt yet.
Fascinating nevertheless, though!
Is it a sign for someone born under the sign of Cancer like me?

I peacefully fell asleep, and found myself in the land of dreams. I was an adventurer who had arrived at a large, bustling port city, a picturesque town full of marbled, stone buildings. It was a picturesque town. Anyways, there were many sights to see, both within the city and outside near it, and in the end I decided to...
Explore the golden coastline nearby and see what secrets it holds
Make my way to a nearby shrine, nicknamed the Lady's Stone by locals
Visit the docks, and find the houses of pleasure near it
Walk through the streets and take in the sights
Some have told me that the process of dying is like stepping into a strange but gentle dream. Is there any truth to this?
Perhaps. But thinking about this is unhelpful while we're alive.
Life is but a dream as well, is it not?
I won't know for sure until I begin my final journey myself.
The scholars of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith say that when one dies...

Ever since I was a child, there was one servant in our family I was always close to and was like a second parent to me. She passed away of old age a couple days ago, and I have been greatly affected by this, feeling drained and mentally exhausted at times, trying to process this event. Strangely, last night, she visited me in a dream.
I try to recall what happened.

We met somewhere in my dream - I cannot tell where, but all I recall was some sort of brilliant light, and the feeling of a gentle breeze caressing my face. My servant told me she had always loved me like her own child, but now she had to go. She embraced me, wished me the best in life, and said goodbye for one last time before her final journey. I felt much better after that dream.
Farewell... but will it be forever?

One of my trusted servants is on his deathbed. His death will come as a blow to many of us, as we respected the old man for his patience, humility, and wisdom, which he tried his best to impart to us. I and others are by his bedside as his final hour draws near, and I ask him if he is afraid of the end.
He smiles gently.

End? No, the journey doesn't end here, he says. "Death is just another path, one that we all must take. The grey rain-curtain of this world rolls back, and all turns to silver glass. And then you see it.... White shores... and beyond, a far green country under a swift sunrise." He looks at me serenely, before closing his eyes. Several hours later, he passes away.
I stay by his bedside for some time, contemplating his words.

I walk through a vast expanse of green grass, covered above by a sky of pure, pale blue. I come to a river where I see many people. I recognize them all as people in my life who passed away, some many years ago, from relatives and friends to old servants.\n\nOne goes up to me and says in a calm but concerned tone, "Why are you here? You will join us on this journey one day, but it is not your time yet. But you can enjoy the sunshine and fresh air with us for a little longer."
I wake up peacefully, after spending time relaxing in that strange dream world.

While walking near my residence, I spotted something on the ground by a patch of grass. To my surprise, I found a rat lying on its side. I was not fearful of it, as I realized it was dying. Its eyes gazed at me with a look full of solemn clarity, in a way one did not expect from such a creature - almost as if it was telling me something. Then, it stopped moving, and passed away.
There was something profound about it. Life is full of wonders.
That was weird. But a rat's a rat. Well now! Back to my walk.
An extraordinary rat! I'll cover its body with leaves as a sign of respect.

That night, I dreamt I was standing in front of an old woman I never met before. Despite her age, she carried herself with grace, and she curtsied me. "Thank you for your kind gesture earlier today," she said. "Most would have ignored me. Whatever your intentions, your noble deed brings me peace in the afterlife, and I can move on." When I woke up, I was confused.
There was no way... could it have been?

An acquaintance of mine was on his deathbed, unconscious and unresponsive for days. His family had gathered around him to pray and prepare his soul for the afterlife, when all of a sudden, he sat up, alert and sharp. His family was relieved and tried to talk to him, thinking he had recovered somehow, yet he just kept asking for me to come visit.
I hastened to come to his bedside to witness this little miracle.
\n\nI wonder why he wanted to see me?

When I arrived at his house and entered his bedroom, he clapped with joy, and beckoned me to sit next to him. He inquired about various matters of state and provided me advice, claiming it was given to him by the wise spirits of the deceased. We humored him for an hour or so until he said he was tired, and bid all farewell. The moment he closed his eyes, he passed away.
Strangely, his advice turned out to be actually very helpful.

I am pouring over a document at my desk at night when I see an adorable little girl scurrying back and forth in my room. Upon seeing each other, we both stare in confusion, so I ask her who she is and why she's here. "I'm cold and hungry," she mumbles shyly. Feeling sorry for her, I point to some food I had left on my table, and tell her to eat some.
Thank you, my [Root.GetLordLady], she squeaks, before she eats.

I suddenly wake up, realizing I must have dozed off while reading, and that the little girl must have been from a dream I had. I go to finish the rest of my food, but contrary to what I remember, none of my meal is left, save for a few crumbs.\n\nThe next morning, when I ask about her, I learned her appearance matched one of my guard's daughters, who passed away from illness a few days ago. The guard, a devout [Root.Religion.GetName] believer, tells me he is certain I helped her soul pass into the afterlife, and thanks me.
She was a polite, kind child. She is surely at peace now.
It must be a coincidence, but if it makes you feel better.

A trusted guard recently got injured, and while it thankfully isn't too painful, it's clear that it doesn't bode well for his health as he is now bedridden for much of the day. He is old and about to retire, anyways. One morning, you pay a visit when he tells you his grandparents stopped by just before you did. You point out that they died decades ago, but he assures you they did visit.
Are you really sure? Maybe you are imagining things.
Really! A truly marvelous thing. I hope they mean well.
Perhaps they did come. The universe is full of mysteries.

You receive word that your trusted guard who recently got injured and was on his deathbed just passed away. Strangely, the day before that, his relatives said he told them that his grandparents came to help him pack for a journey. Could that have been a sign of things to come? Strange things have always preceded death, after all, as the stories tell.
He will be missed.

On an official trip, you are passing by one of the villages of your realm. As you leave the borders of the village, you see something odd by a bush and, together with your entourage, go to investigate. To your shock, it is the corpse of a haggard-looking old man in rags. You demand an explanation from the villagers, who say he was the local town beggar who just passed away.
I see. Very well, it is none of my concern - carry on.
Please dispose of the corpse, will you? It's unclean.
Beggar or not, everyone deserves to be treated with dignity!
\n\nYou make the villagers give the man a proper funeral. Yet instead of being angry, the villagers are moved by your compassion.

There are those who argue a quick death is better, for it will be less painful and you won't have as much to worry and ruminate over. Others believe a slow and gradual death is preferable, for it gives one time to let go of regrets, pray, and make peace with one's family, friends, and [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
I prefer a quick death - things are simpler that way.
It's better if one has time to prepare before passing on.

Several hooligans were recently caught trying to raid a cemetery not too far from where I live, and they were apprehended by the local watchmen. This, of course, is absolutely forbidden out of respect for the spirits of the dead, and it is now up to me to determine the fate of these men.
Release the desperate, poor men. They've learned their lesson.
To think they wanted to desecrate the dead! Toss them in prison.

Stories abound of ghosts frequently passing through a village in [Root.GetName]. The locals are of two minds, unsure on how to react to this. Some are terrified, and believe it is best to send in holy men and women to exorcise these restless spirits. Others view this through a more rational lens, seeing it as a blessing and an opportunity to honor and say prayers to the dead. Yet others say these are all just some hallucinations by deranged individuals.
Strange stories, indeed! Who knows what the truth is?

In one of the larger villages of [Root.GetName], a respected elder recently passed away. He was beloved by all for his virtue and wisdom. Few had anything bad to say about him. His funeral attracted many who wished to pay their respects to him, and some even claim that his spirit will provide the land with many blessings before he passes into the afterlife.
May his soul rest in peace.

Last night, I was in bed when I heard a noise. Alarmed, I sat up, and saw a young man pacing to and fro, as if busy with some matter. He apologized to me for the disturbance, and sheepishly said, "I apologize, my [Root.GetLordLady]. I need to take care of business in the underworld and accidentally stumbled here." We exchanged small talk before he left. The next morning, when I asked the people of my household about it, no one reported ever seeing such a man. It is most bizarre!
Maybe it was just a dream, yet it did not feel like a dream....

I am walking down the road when a pretty young woman in white robes approaches me. On her shoulder is a pet owl, though for some reason I suddenly recall that the sacred animal of the [Root.Religion.GetName] deity of death was an owl. The girl smiles, revealing an oddly long tongue, and she asks if she can kiss me. As her owl flutters away, I feel something is off.
I hastily make an excuse and leave the stranger alone.
Oh, I'm just nervous! Come to me, my beauty!

The girl moves forward, but her tongue suddenly extends forth, becoming unnaturally long. Her pretty visage turns into that of an old, withered hag. I am trapped, unable to move. She licks my face, and I feel darkness overtake me.... And then I wake up. It was just a nightmare, but how was I that stupid to be seduced by the Goddess of Death! An ill omen, but at least it was just a dream.
Right...?

Shortly before a respected member of the local [Root.Culture.GetName] community died recently, several relatives claimed to witness the shrieking and wailing of banshees, both of gruesome or comely visage. Today, though, I wondered to myself: while people understandably fear these female spirits, isn't it nice to have a warning when something bad might happen?
At least that's what I think.
It's stupid superstition either way.

[target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetTitledName] claimed that last night, [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetSheHe] came across a Myling - the ghost of a dead child who had been wrongly killed by its parents. [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetFirstName] knew it was a dangerous but inescapable situation, and rushed to guide the child to a nearby cemetery, a hallowed ground. Yet, contrary to the scary [Root.Religion.GetName] tales, the child was friendly and thanked [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetFirstName] for [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetHerHis] compassion.

[target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetTitledName] claimed that last night, [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetSheHe] came across a Myling - the ghost of a dead child who had been wrongly killed by its parents. [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetFirstName] knew it was a dangerous but inescapable situation, and rushed to guide the child to a nearby cemetery, a hallowed ground. Yet, contrary to the scary [Root.Culture.GetName] tales, the child was friendly and thanked [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetFirstName] for [target_VIET_myling_courtier.GetHerHis] compassion.
Ha! An interesting tale. You always loved making up stories.
It's either a dream or a lie. Mylings are vengeful beings, not harmless!
Oh dear! At least the ghost seemed like a kind one.

On the road, my entourage and I come across a [Root.Religion.GetName] holy man, dressed in robes. He is kneeling on the ground, looking at nowhere in particular, as he chants some prayers.\n\nAfter he finishes, I ask him what he was doing, and he explains that recently, a woman died here in an accident. She was a poor woman with no family, so this holy man, out of compassion, gave her a modest but dignified funeral. He hopes her spirit will find peace with [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
For a mere peasant? What a waste of time.
I understand. Carry on, then. We shan't bother you.
How noble! May we join you in praying for her spirit?

A most amusing yet strange tale! I know of this noblewoman in my realm who is quite annoying. She's not a bad person, but she's unbelievably chatty and intensely emotional, and if crossed can be quite a nag. Though middle aged, she died a few weeks ago... only to come back to life a few hours later. She said that apparently Death came to get her, but was so fed up with her company that he hurried to take her back home so he could come get her later. She's still healthy today.
Ha ha! I do feel sorry for old Death.
She was seeing things at the time, but that's funny.

I rest in bed one evening when I hear a knock on the door. Thinking it is one of my servants, I beckon them in, only to see a pleasant young woman I do not recognize. Suddenly, there is a chill in the air, and the candles flicker out. The stranger looks at me with her dark eyes, and I hold my breath in anticipation. "I am Death," she says in a low, yet soothing whisper. "It's time for..."
Wait... what's going on?
\n\nIs it... is it time for me to go?
Common Mistake

Surprisingly, I am calm as I wait for her to finish - if it is my time to go, there isn't much I can do. But she stops herself and looks around, as if she just realized where she is. Suddenly, the candles are alight once more, and she bows to me.\n\nI look at her in bewilderment as she says, "I'm so sorry! You're the wrong person... I knew I got lost somehow. Dammit... why does this happen to me? I'm so unprofessional. Oh! My sincere apologies, I know this is such an inconvenience to you. And... um, by the way, I know I'm not in any position to ask, but do you by any chance know the way to..."
Um.... Is it the village by the river of.... And it's north of.... I know it!

\n\nTo be fair to her, it is confusing if you've never been there before, so I kindly provide her some directions. I reassure her, when she looks embarrassed, "It's a common mistake everyone makes. The roads in that part can be disorienting!"
Good Directions

Thank you so much! the maiden says cheerfully, with a beaming smile before she leaves. "I'll be back later, but not today. I wish you nothing but luck and fortune, [Root.GetFirstName]!"

The next morning, no one knows what I'm talking about when I ask if they saw a girl with the same description as that maiden. I chalk up the whole incident as a dream my sleep-deprived mind concocted, until I later receive news in the afternoon that an acquaintance of mine died last night.

He happened to live in that village the maiden needed to travel to.
That absentminded girl who visited me was... Death?
I'm pretty sure it's a coincidence and was just a dream.

A wandering holy man is stopping by our court today, and telling us stories of the various phenomena he has encountered, as he is sometimes called on by people to resolve supernatural problems. For instance, recently, as he passed by a village in my domain, he had to exorcise a mischievous ghost who made loud noises and threw around objects in a peasant's house.
Fascinating! Some spirits are just as troublesome as the living.
I am not sure whether I find such a story believable.

Commoners have always told tales about corpses rising from the dead if their funerals were not performed properly, or if they died in unjust ways. Lately I hear more and more rumors about such occurrences in the region, but the scholars and clergy assure me such things are mere superstitions. No true believer of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith would ever believe in such drivel!
I agree very much with the views of the learned men.
You can never be so sure, right? Maybe the peasants are right.

I was thinking today - all the people who have come and go since the beginning of time.... It is interesting, if somber, to imagine what they would think of us, their descendants, and whether they would be proud or disappointed in us.
It is a good question.
When I die one day - as all do, inevitably - will people still remember me?
Of course! I'm such a great [Root.GetTitle].
Why wouldn't they? They'll still remember.
They won't, and I hate that that is what will happen.
No, but that's not a bad thing. Life will go on!

I'm paying a visit to an acquaintance of mine, who nearly died in an accident when she was a young woman, and was in fact unconscious for a week after it before she slowly recovered. She said that during that week, she actually had a glimpse of the afterlife, and she said it looked like a simple yet beautiful garden filled with light. The experience moved her greatly.
Perhaps that is what the afterlife will be. We'll see for sure, one day.

I'm paying a visit to an acquaintance of mine, who nearly died in an accident when he was a young man, and was in fact unconscious for a week after it before he slowly recovered. He said that during that week, he actually had a glimpse of the afterlife, and he said it looked like a quiet, peaceful beach full of bright sunshine. The experience moved him greatly.
Perhaps that is what the afterlife will be. We'll see for sure, one day.

Though my parents have passed away for quite some time, I suddenly recalled a warm, happy memory of them today. Regardless of my feelings about them while they were alive, even after death, my memories of them can bring me joy.
I am glad.

In several villages of [Root.GetName], there are reports of strange processions of people at night, wearing somber clothing, and accompanied by bustling winds and a chill in the air. Locals believe that for whatever reason, these are spirits of the dead going to and fro. Others, such as more rational scholars and clergy, think this might simply just be a few scattered accounts of hallucinations.
Strange times we live in.

Several heinous murders were recently committed in [Root.GetName], the victims' corpses horrifically mutilated. Authorities were unable to find the perpetrator until local guards devised a cunning ambush and caught him, who turned out to be a young nobleman whom everyone thought was friendly and kind! He cackled with glee as he lunged at the guards and they were forced to kill him, for he preferred to die rather than be caught alive and be brought to trial for his crimes.
A tragic story. Alas! Such madmen exist.
Reward the guards for their deeds.

Phantoms were observed in large numbers in a specific region of [Root.GetName], though the witnesses claimed these ghosts were harmless, and were preoccupied with engaging in mundane activities like chatting, enjoying feasts, singing, dancing, and playing various games - almost like as if there was a separate town of ghosts at night. No reputable scholar or clergy has been able to verify these claims.
We must give these spirits their due respect!
These silly peasants are hallucinating things.

The death of several important officials in [Root.GetName] around the same time has thrown the region into a bit of chaos, given the difficulties in securing reliable replacements for several positions at the same time. This will likely cause some disruptions to the local administration, but hopefully it will be brief.
Unfortunate, but let's do our best.
Thankfully, I already prepared some contingency plans.

A powerful local official in [Root.GetName] recently died. Given his prominence, many mourned at first, until evidence of severe corruption was discovered among his belongings and properties, from bribery to involvement in smuggling to abuses of local peasants. He cunningly covered it all up under his benevolent facade. After all this came out and we learned of the mind-boggling magnitude of his corruption, it's certain province will do much better without him!
A pity we didn't catch him while he was still alive.

A hermit has lived in the wilderness of [Root.GetName] for decades, engaging in meditation, prayer, and other spiritual practices. He was kind and always offered spiritual teachings for any who requested it, though he refused all offerings of food, drink, or other luxuries. Now, news arrives that he has passed away while meditating - and yet, his corpse still sits upright, and does not decay at all. Locals have begun to make pilgrimage to receive blessings from the hermit's presence.
A most interesting development.

A runestone has recently been discovered in [Root.GetName]. It appears to be centuries old at the least, and though the writing is difficult to read, you were able to find a local scholar who could translate it, and who says the runestone seems to have been carved and raised many generations ago following the death of some important local figure in their honor. Little else can be discerned, given the writing is so worn out and in an ancient style.
A piece of history, no less!

An old woman passed away in [Root.GetName] recently. Though a humble villager, this beloved "grandmother of all" lived a very long time - more than a century, some claim - and was of humble and virtuous temperament, doing her best to guide the community and provide her wisdom to all. She received visitors from even local nobles from other villages nearby. There have already been claims that her spirit will bless these lands for many years to come.
This grandmother will be sorely missed.
There are many places who ascribe all manner of ill omens to black cats, that seeing one is a portent of death. Today, I just happened to come across a stray black cat.
I will go away as quickly as I can.
I fear no cat. It even looks sweet.
\n\nThough you feel a strange feeling, as if... something isn't right.

The [Root.Culture.GetName] people have always seen black cats as a sign of good luck and fortune, so long as they are treated with respect. Yet I hear tales of people from other lands fearing them as harbingers of death and destruction, and even sad and gut-wrenching tales of black cats being tortured and murdered because of this.
Such are the strange and horrifying customs of others!

I am traveling in a less populated and more rugged part of my realm, and my entourage and I come across a number of corpses, and the stench of decaying flesh is noticeable to everyone. Judging by the armor and clothing on the bodies, as well as the wounds on them, it seems that this may have been the scene of a recent battle between rival bandit gangs that infest this region.
These lowly people deserve to be food for vultures and crows.
Let's properly dispose of these bodies, lest they rise as vengeful spirits!
Bandits or not, we should give them a funeral, to ease their souls.

I was making my way through a local town market when I felt something was watching me. I looked around and saw nothing, yet could not shake off the feeling. My concerned guards thought maybe I sensed an assassin. A passing holy man noticed my anxiety, and told me cryptically: "Ah, a ghost seems attached to you. Don't worry - it's a gentle spirit who means no harm, and who is more curious and playful than anything. It might even help you out, and will leave you alone once its curiosity has been sated."
He had disappeared into the crowds before I could question him further.

A local townsman is accused of abominable crimes! Known for his insatiable lust, he frequents houses of ill repute and tries to seduce any woman, from innocent virgins to old widows. He even went to graveyards at night to fornicate with the lonely female ghosts - or so his accusers claim to have witnessed. Others argue that despite his vices, there is no sound evidence of this.
Clearly baseless stories made up by his enemies. Ignore the matter.
This man is a necrophiliac! He must be executed immediately!
Such terrible things - he will be imprisoned, make no mistake.

My servant's pet dog died. As he was really close to the dog, he's been feeling rather dejected and sad, which has been affecting his ability to perform his duties. Perhaps I should say something to him?
Silly boy, it's just a stupid dog. Get over it.
Shape up or else I'll punish you severely.
Cheer up! We'll find you a new dog.
It's in a better place now but take your time to grieve.

While I am in one of the more distant parts of my realm, I come across an ancient tombstone partly buried in the ground. On it are etched the words:

Remember me as you pass by,
As you are now, so once was I,
As I am now, so you will be,
Prepare for death and follow me.
Alas! We are but dust and shadows.

Last night, I had a most wonderful dream! I found myself basking in a realm of infinite light - nothing but light - and saw before me many men and women, some of whom I recognized as my deceased relatives. Even those I did not recognize I knew were my distant ancestors. We neither talked nor interacted directly, and I merely basked in their benevolent presence.
After I woke up, I felt most blessed.
The herbs I bought today should help me stay healthy. Per the physician's instructions, I am to drink it daily as a tonic to maintain my health until I run out of it.
I hope this is a good investment.

A quack doctor who had been notoriously operating in the area for some time has finally been arrested for selling fraudulent medical concoctions, some known to be deadly. Unlike other physicians who have proper medicinal training on topics like the four humors and herbology, this one is a conman who wants to dupe idiots and take their money.
Send him to prison immediately!
Force him to drink one of his poisons!
Let him go. I'm sure he learned his lesson.

I am listening to a debate between two local physicians on the best way to treat a certain medical ailment. Though I don't understand everything they discuss, their expoundings on various medical theories and ideas, such as the four humors, how the various organs of the body work, and what herbs are most effective, are strangely fascinating.
How learned they must be!
You're both incorrect. Galen said that if a person is coughing, and blood and bile...

A learned man is traveling through town to exchange knowledge with the physicians in the area. He is knowledgeable about medical treatments, particularly surgery, and has invited several of us to go see a demonstration of his surgical skills when he operates on a lesser nobleman. It will be a rather squeamish affair, though. Should I attend?
I've dealt with worse - this sounds educational!
No. A [Root.GetTitle] like me has more pressing concerns.
Perhaps I can even assist his procedure with my skills.

I overhear one of my servants muttering, "Oh dear, was it two spoons or three?"\n\nWhen I asked her what she was talking about, she tells me she forgot how much medicine she needed to take for her recent stomach pains.
Uh... no idea myself. Good luck!
You're clearly a moron if you forgot.
Actually, it should be four spoons.

One of your courtiers accidentally took the wrong medicine. It appeared they confused two different concoctions they were supposed to take at different times and with different doses. One can only hope there are no significant negative side effects to this!
Oh dear! That sounds unpleasant.
You are drinking some herbal tea that is meant to be a good health tonic. However, you drink a little too fast and burn your tongue in front of everyone.
Ouch! But at least it's good for me!

I overhear a scholar and a merchant debate the merits of quarantines during plagues. The scholar says that wise men and physicians have always advised that those with contagious diseases must be kept away from the healthy. The merchant says isolating communities will destroy business opportunities and render the settlements impotent and weak. What do I think?
It is a silly idea - how can we live if we all cower in fear, alone?
We need to listen to the scholars' wisdom to survive hardship.
I honestly don't care about this.
I had a sore throat earlier and took this herbal concoction to make it better, as some suggested to me. Though I'll admit my throat does feel better, the medicine tasted disgusting!
Ugh! I can't make that taste go away.

I stopped by the kitchen to see what my cooks were up to. They are preparing some dishes made with panch poron, a spice mix made from five seeds. Unlike other spice mixes, here, the seeds are not ground into powder.
Carry on.
Don't use that! I prefer powdered spices.
My servants give me some traditional stringed cheese, which often has black caraway added to it for taste. It is a good snack.
Thank you.

One of my servants was having shortness of breath earlier today for some unknown reason, and it looked serious until another servant, known for being sharp, immediately grabbed some black caraway and made the other servant eat them. The seed is known for helping with cases of shortness of breath, and helped stabilize the ill servant. While the ill servant has gone to the physician to see if anything is wrong, perhaps I should reward my other quick-witted servant?
These are just mere servants.
Some nice words and a gift will do.
Promote the servant to a full courtier.

I was gifted some shampoo made from the juice of a plant called the kaffir lime. It is quite popular and said to be effective against lice, dandruff, and other things that might bother the hair and scalp.
A nice gift, and much appreciated.
Perhaps my spouse might like this?
I have a courtier who might want it.

It is often tradition to season simple dishes, such as cabbage and cucumber, with the dried leaves and seed of the lovage plant to add some flavor. There are some who claim it can turn even these simple vegetables into something delicious! I tried a sample of lovage mixed in vegetables today.
It was actually quite good!
Bleh! It's just food of the peasants!

You are visiting an acquaintance's house and notices she maintains a lot of plants, specifically the mahleb cherry, on her property. It is commonly used for many different breads and desserts in [Root.Culture.GetName] cooking. She says you are welcome to take some back home for your cooks to use.
Don't mind if I do!
No thanks.
You are drinking some herbal tea made from the majoram plant. They say it is a symbol of happiness and joy.
The tea tastes good, too.
I somehow got myself a lot of mastic. Using it as a chewing gum is said to have many medicinal benefits, on top of reducing any unpleasant odors from my breath.
It is nice to have.

The perfumer excitedly shows me his musk perfume. I take a sniff, and note it smells pleasant the way animal musk usually does. Then the perfumer tells me his secret: it is not musk made from animals, but from the oil of the seeds of a medicinal plant, known as the musk mallow, ambrette, or rose mallow. I was fooled there for a good moment!
A fun idea. I'll buy some!
Let me get some for my spouse.
A nice novelty, but I am not interested.
The servant asks if I want some mustard seed with my meal.
No thanks!
A good idea.

You pass by the market and see a peddler peddling his goods, in particular various spices and herbs. He has a lot of nutmeg this time, and is selling it for a little cheaper than he usually does. When you sample a bit, it is clear that this is real nutmeg and not an attempt at fraud.
What are we waiting for? I'll buy some!
It's good nutmeg, but I don't need more.
I was eating some delicious nutmeg flavored sweets when I started feeling unusually ill. My physician said it seems I simply ate too much nutmeg, which in large doses can cause a variety of symptoms.
Hopefully it goes away soon!
Someone presented me with a large gift of oregano.
Looks like we will eat a lot of that for a while.
I received a gift of some orris oil, made from the orris root. It has a variety of uses. What should I do with it?
Give it to a perfumer, obviously, to make perfumes.
Allow my cooks use it as tincture to flavor syrup.
Let my physician have access for his herbal medicines.
We have decorated our hair ornaments with kewra, a fragrance made from the pandan palm.
It smells nice.
My cooks have just received a shipment of parsley to use in my food.
More parsley!
You have heard that the some ancient people held parsley to be paradoxically sacred and evil, for it first sprouted from the blood of one of their heroes according to their legends.
Come on, that's silly and makes no sense.
Perhaps there is logic behind this.
I was warned by an elderly servant not to touch or eat parsley. "If you love someone," she said, "then bad things will happen and ruin your love. Parsley is a useful herb, but it is also evil!"
Ha, that's just an old wives tale.
Thank you for telling me!

You happen to pass through the countryside when you encounter a farmer. Curious about what he does, you ask him about what he grows and the land he farms on, and notice there is one spot he avoids. "Too much parsley grows there," he explains, "and everyone knows that parsley are the herbs that visit hell. ‘tis bad luck."
That is very wise of you!
What silly superstition.
You put too much pepper on your food.
I'll bear with it.
Don't eat it.
I sit at the windowsill, staring outside. What do I see far away that I observe with great scrutiny?
Nature's somber awe - plants, the skies, the sun before me.
A group of peasant children playing games outside.
Some of my guardsmen marching around on patrol.
An attractive young [Root.GetManWomanOpp] passing through.
An attractive young [Root.GetManWoman] passing through.

In my dream, I live in a large mansion of unrivaled beauty, so vast it could not have been built by mundane means. It is a gorgeous residence where I have all the comforts of home - food, drink, and entertainment at my beck and call, and all manner of exotic mechanical and magical contraptions. And yet I am trapped. Every time I try to escape, I end up coming back, somehow!
This is no way to live! I must be free!
Since it is here before me, I guess I can enjoy it.
Only fools take for granted the gifts they're given.

You pass by a small ancient ruin while traveling through a village. The peasant acting as your guide tells you of a local folk legend, that centuries ago when a plague struck the area, one of the locals holed himself up in the ruin - as it was his house back then - and died there by himself when he ran out of food and drink. His lonely spirit, supposedly, still haunts the area to this day.
An interesting tale, I suppose!
One of my courtiers has been spending time at home an awful lot as of late. When I went to investigate, I learned that they recently picked up board games as a hobby.
Perhaps I can play a game or two with them.
It's a childish waste of their time.
I can teach you some strategies for your favorite game.
I am pacing back and forth inside my residence, thinking about this or that, and then I accidentally bump into some of the furniture.
Whoops! Silly me!

Some of my young maidservants screamed in terror when a mouse scurried past us one morning. The mouse was nowhere to be found after a quick search, but some of the girls are still scared and worry there may be more mice at my home.
Poor children. Worry not, the mouse is gone!
Come on now. Grow up already, be a little brave!
The mice are our brothers and sisters, we should respect them.
A worrisome sight! We must remain vigilant.

I was bored at home with nothing to do one day, so I decided to take a walk around when I overheard some muffled sounds coming from a room. I snuck over and opened the door slightly, and peeked inside. One of my maids and one of my manservants were making love and in the throes of passion, oblivious to the world around them! Though young, they should know better.
Barge in and order them to stop doing this in public.
Secretly watch them eagerly but don't tell them.
Forget it - it is none of my business.
Tell them later they have your blessing.
A loud noise is heard outside and on instinct I rush to the window, curious. I look out and see nothing out of the ordinary.
Odd. Is my imagination playing tricks on me?
I've been staying up a lot lately out of boredom.
It's not a healthy thing, but I can't resist.
I'll try to make the most of my bad habit.

I visited a friend of mine recently. As we took a walk outside and made small talk, they wanted to offer me a present. It turned out to be an oddly shaped metal stick, so I was offended at first. "This is a very good lockpick," I was told. "Once you get the hang of it, you can open any lock. I don't need it, but I think even a great [Root.GetTitle] like you could find use for it."
Ah! An intriguing gift... but one that could come in handy.
I am a [Root.GetTitle] - I leave dirty work to my spies and assassins!

I am at a local banquet when the host presents me with a ceramic tankard as a gift. While simple in design, it was clearly created by an expert craftsman, so though I may not necessarily use it in more formal occasions like a great feast, I could keep it for everyday use.
Thank you for the thoughtful gift.
It is too plain for a [Root.GetTitle] like me.

A gang of female thieves had been recently preying on male travelers in the nearby area with a unique method. They would first seduce them and offer them erotic delights. Afterwards, they would entice their victim to strip naked. When their victim's guard was down, they would steal the man's belongings before running off, leaving the victim naked and humiliated. Your guards had difficulty catching the culprits until a cunning adventurer helped them ambush the thieves.
Very good. I don't have money for a reward, though.
Quite impressive. This gift of gold shall do.
Pay them and request they give our guards some tips for the future.
What a talented person - I need them with me at my court.
The adventurer will join your court, providing you valuable services with their knowledge and skills.

In my dream last night, I lived in a beautiful cottage. Though simple, it had all manner of convenience, and I had all the food, drink, and entertainment I needed to live a happy life. When I woke up, I found myself missing the place.
It was a nice dream, all said.

As you walk through your residence one evening, by chance you look outside - and there, before you, is a most spectacular sight. The sun is setting, and it looks gorgeous. You gaze, speechless, as you admire the union of yellow, orange, red, and pink colors that shine through the few clouds in the sky.
Amazing.

You recently heard tales of a land where the sun is always shining, the flowers are always blooming, fruits are always hanging from the trees, and the waters are calm and of a beautiful light blue color. It is said that if one travels far across the sea, one will eventually reach this hidden paradise, and that the natives will welcome one like kin.
Ha! If I kept sailing across the ocean I doubt I'd find such a land.
One day someone will travel the seas to conquer this land, I'm sure.
The question is whether the natives follow the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.

We were traveling in the wilderness when we came across an old ruin. The locals say it was built by long-lost inhabitants of this land, and was perhaps once used as a fortress, or a tomb, or a shrine. We shall never know, for all that remains are a few stones and one lone column. At any rate, my entourage and I rested there for a while, before we made our way.
Will our monuments be like those ruins, too, one day?

The baklava bakers of [Root.GetName] have gained some fame as the best in the region. Some people will travel far and wide to sample the tasty, sugary, syrupy delights that the area has become known for.
Delicious! That reminds me, I need to buy some baklava.

An exotic traveler from a faraway land is visiting my court today. Though an older gentleman, there is a handsome quality to him that can only come with the wisdom of old age. He has strange but thoughtful ideas, so I enjoy talking with him. We are discussing many fascinating matters when he asks me, "Have you ever heard of Scarborough Fair?"
Perhaps... I answer, "but what do you mean by that?"
Scarborough Fair

Scarborough is an actual place, but the song, Scarborough Fair, is a most profound ballad about human existence, he says. When I ask him to explain, he sings the song to me:

"Are you going to Scarborough Fair?
Parsley, sage, rosemary, and thyme.
Remember me to one who lives there
She once was a true love of mine."

The man smiles and hands me a piece of paper. "Though it is an impossible task, we are all traveling to Scarborough Fair, dear friend. keep my copy of the lyrics so you can study the wisdom in its words."
He smiles at me kindly as I accept his gift.
At the end of the road, of the journey we all must take, no matter how impossible, is Scarborough Fair....
